description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Advanced EMT (Emergency Medical Technologist) | Georgetown | M-F, 2:30p - 11p
Functional Area
Clinical - Emergency
City
Georgetown
Work Location Type
On-site
State
TX
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
Join Austin Radiological Association, Transform your Career and Radiology!
Who We Are
:
Since its inception in 1954,
Austin Radiological Association (ARA Diagnostic Imaging)
has been a cornerstone of healthcare in Central Texas. With a network of 17 state-of-the-art outpatient imaging centers and collaborations with 24 area hospitals, we’re at the forefront of medical imaging in the region. Our partnership with
Radiology Partners
in 2019 has further enhanced our capabilities in AI technology, expanded our scale, and integrated us into a comprehensive national infrastructure.
What We Offer
:
ARA
is dedicated to providing exceptional career opportunities and keeping our team at the cutting edge of technology. We know the value of work-life balance and are committed to the personal well-being of all our team members.
Here’s why you should join the
ARA
/
RP
team:
Competitive salaries
Advancement opportunities
Comprehensive insurance packages
Wellness programs that include mental health
Flexible scheduling for multiple positions
Access to industry-leading AI-diagnostics
ARA
is seeking a highly motivated
Advanced EMT (Emergency Medical Technician)
to join our growing team!
Summary:
Support technical and medical staff by ensuring consistent patient workflow. Following Clinical Operating Guidelines, responsible for providing quality patient medical care and performing all duties in a safe and professional manner to ensure the safety of all patients, customers, and employees.
Desired Professional Skills and Experience:
Successful completion of a Texas Department State Health Services approved AEMT program.
Certified Texas Advanced Emergency Medical Technician; current AHA Basic Life Support certification and Advanced cardiac life support.
At minimum, one year of EMT experience in a healthcare setting is preferred.
Radiology Partners is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer committed to providing equal opportunities in all our employment practices. The Practice prohibits discrimination, harassment, and retaliation in any form based on race; color; religion; genetic information; national origin; sex; sexual orientation; gender identity and expression; pregnancy; age; disability; citizenship status; veteran status; or any other category protected by federal, state, or local laws.
CCPA Notice: When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers and (2) Education and Employment History.
Radiology Partners participates in E-verify.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages
:
Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team at recruiting@radpartners.com.
Back to job list
Apply

title: Advanced Practice Provider - Northside Radiology Associates
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Advanced Practice Provider - Northside Radiology Associates
City
Atlanta
Work Location Type
On-site
State
GA
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Northside Radiology Associates is seeking a highly skilled Physician Assistant (PA) or Nurse Practitioner (NP) to work in collaboration with radiologists to provide high-quality patient care. The ideal candidate will be proficient in providing procedure and imaging-based radiology services in both hospital and outpatient clinic-based practice setting.  This role involves patient evaluation, history and physical examinations, ordering and interpreting diagnostic studies, performing image-guided procedures, and developing treatment plans within the established standards of care. The PA/NP will also serve as a clinical leader, contributing to process improvement initiatives and fostering communication between referring physicians, medical staff, and patients.
POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide comprehensive medical services under the supervision and direction of the radiologist in hospital, outpatient, and affiliated office settings.
Perform initial patient assessments, including history and physical exams.
Order and interpret diagnostic tests as appropriate.
Perform image-guided procedures, including but not limited to:
Arthrograms
Joint injections
Lumbar punctures
Paracentesis
Cystograms
Tube studies
Barium swallows
Biopsies
Drain placements
Hysterosalpingography (HSG)
Provide contrast coverage as needed.
Obtain informed consent and educate patients and families regarding procedures and treatment plans.
Write and manage pre-, intra-, and post-procedure orders.
Serve as a liaison between patients, nursing staff, referring physicians, and radiologists.
Perform daily rounds, monitor patient progress, and provide updates to medical staff, including writing daily progress notes when necessary.
Make treatment recommendations in collaboration with the radiologist.
Lead and participate in process improvement projects within the radiology program.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Northside Radiology Associates has been the exclusive provider of radiological services at Northside Hospital since 1970. Highly subspecialized and board-certified, we are honored to provide our expertise to the patients and referring physicians of Northside Hospital and its affiliates.
We offer an excellent work-life balance, very competitive compensation and a generous benefits packaging to include CME allowance, professional licensure, profit sharing/401(k), safe harbor, moving expenses (up to IRS allowable), professional liability, health and dental insurance, as well as life and disability insurance.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Current licensure and certification to practice as a Physician Assistant or Nurse Practitioner in the State of Georgia.
BLS certification required; ACLS certification preferred.
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university required.
Experience in interventional radiology or comparable invasive procedures preferred.
Strong proficiency in written and oral communication with medical professionals and patients.
Ability to work effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $115,000-$125,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
For more information or how to apply:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Matthew McClellan at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or
281-738-1785.
RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion, and a healthy respect for differences.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify
.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages:
Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team at
recruiting@radpartners.com
.
Back to job list
Apply

Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Up to $100k commencement bonus
Up to 20% neuro studies
100% remote position with the support of a remote team
Small practice culture of collaboration and camaraderie, backed by the support of national resources
Robust compensation package to include:
Increased compensation model with uncapped earning potential.
Increased wRVU value for XR
Medical, dental and vision
401k and other investment opportunities
Partnership and profit sharing
7on/14off (4pm-2am CST) with the additional moonlighting opportunities.
Short path to partnership
24/7 worklist specialists and state-of-the art AI tools – spend your time reading
The CORE team supports us by managing urgent calls, coordinating with doctors, and resolving image issues, letting us focus on our core tasks

Matrix is the premier, internal teleradiology practice for the leading radiology group in the nation. We stand at the forefront of radiology groups nationwide, embodying a fusion of excellence and empowerment. Join us in redefining the future of radiological innovation.
Get to know our practice!
https://www.ra
d
partners.com/m
atrix/

Neuro experience preferred
Fellows and residents welcome to apply
Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
The ideal candidate will be comfortable reading all areas of DX Radiology with a focus on Acute Care Radiology (Emergency Room, ICU, Trauma, etc.)
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy and have residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $425,000-$800,000. Increased wRVU value for XR Medical, dental and vision 401k and other investment opportunities Partnership and profit sharing 7on/7off (4pm-1am CST) with the additional moonlighting opportunities. Short path to partnership 24/7 worklist specialists and state-of-the art AI tools – spend your time reading The CORE team supports us by managing urgent calls, coordinating with doctors, and resolving image issues, letting us focus on our core tasks PRACTICE OVERVIEW WITH MATRIX Matrix is the premier, internal teleradiology practice for the leading radiology group in the nation. We stand at the forefront of radiology groups nationwide, embodying a fusion of excellence and empowerment. Join us in redefining the future of radiological innovation. Get to know our practice! https://www.ra d partners.com/m atrix/ DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Neuro training preferred Fellows and residents welcome to apply Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology The ideal candidate will be comfortable reading all areas of DX Radiology with a focus on Acute Care Radiology (Emergency Room, ICU, Trauma, etc.) Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy and have residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology COMPENSATION: The salary range for this position is $550,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY: For inquiries about this position, please contact Marrah Perry at recruiting@radpartners.com or 315-879-5077. RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owne d practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve. Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences. Radiology Partners participates in E-verify . CCPA Notice : When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History. Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team at recruiting@radpartners.com .

Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Up to $100k commencement bonus
Up to 20% neuro studies
100% remote position with the support of a remote team
Small practice culture of collaboration and camaraderie, backed by the support of national resources.
Robust compensation package to include:
Increased compensation model with uncapped earning potential.
Increased wRVU value for XR
Medical, dental and vision
401k and other investment opportunities
Partnership and profit sharing
7on/14off (10pm-8am CST) with the additional moonlighting opportunities.
Short path to partnership
24/7 worklist specialists and state-of-the art AI tools – spend your time reading
The CORE team supports us by managing urgent calls, coordinating with doctors, and resolving image issues, letting us focus on our core tasks
PRACTICE OVERVIEW WITH MATRIX
Matrix is the premier, internal teleradiology practice for the leading radiology group in the nation. We stand at the forefront of radiology groups nationwide, embodying a fusion of excellence and empowerment. Join us in redefining the future of radiological innovation.
Get to know our practice!
https://www.ra
d
partners.com/m
atrix/
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Neuro Training Preferred
Fellows and residents welcome to apply
Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
The ideal candidate will be comfortable reading all areas of DX Radiology with a focus on Acute Care Radiology (Emergency Room, ICU, Trauma, etc.)
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy and have residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $475,000-$900,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Marrah Perry at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or 315-879-5077.

title: Application Analyst II
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Application Analyst II
Functional Area
Teammate - Information Technology
City
Las Vegas
Work Location Type
Hybrid
State
NV
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Radiology Partners has an open position for an Applications Analyst on the Outpatient IT Services team.  The position will report to Outpatient IT Services leadership and be responsible for supporting the full lifecycle of Outpatient applications which include Radiology Information System (RIS), 3D imaging, mammo tracking, online scheduling and other applications as required. The Application Analyst provides accurate and timely maintenance and support services for specified systems and troubleshoots problems. The Application Analyst plays a significant role in application upgrade, new site rollout, migration, and conversion projects.
WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO:
Radiology Partners, through its owned and affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, our mission is to transform radiology by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
WHY RADIOLOGY PARTNERS:
Competitive Benefits package – Eligibility starts the month after hire, with tiered options to choose from.
Compensation Reviews, Career Growth Opportunities
Flexible Remote Schedules
Generous PTO Plans and Paid Holidays
Proudly Certified as a Great Place to Work for Five Consecutive Years
POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Supports full lifecycle of outpatient applications in multiple markets
Supports implementation teams to complete outpatient application upgrades, rollouts to new sites, migrations and conversions projects and process improvement initiatives
Supports application maintenance, image data transfers and onboarding new radiologists
Works with Regional Outpatient IT Directors, Enterprise IT Support, other IT teams and Operations to ensure the needs of RP radiologists are met
Works incidents and service request assigned to them in ServiceNow within defined SLAs and quality measures
Collaborates and communicates with the various parties involved in incident resolution and service request fulfillment
Develops outpatient application test plans and participates in testing activities
Follows all outpatient application support processes, standards, and policies
Identifies enhancement to known solutions within the knowledge base
Prepares and presents technical and/or educational documentation of assigned application systems to enhance the knowledge of customers and team members
Participates in on-call rotation
Work will primarily be remote but requires travel to RP/client locations as needed to complete project and support tasks
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in Health Information Systems or a related discipline, work experience in IT; or the equivalent in education and information technology work experience.
2-3 years diverse IT experience.
2-3 years of clinical application support role; plus for knowledge with PACS, HL7, RIS, voice recognition systems.
Healthcare experience, particularly in radiology, is favored.
Working with a ticket management/service desk system; plus for ServiceNow experience
Sound knowledge of Incident, problem and request management
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Able to work with physicians and various levels of support staff at our customer sites •	Able to work a flexible schedule, supporting clients in multiple time zones.
COMPENSATION
The salary range for this position is $65,000-$75,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
CCPA Notice: When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify
.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages: Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking or other financial information in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please email
Talent@radpartners.com
to notify our team.
Back to job list
Apply

Join Austin Radiological Association, Transform your Career and Radiology!
Who We Are
: Since its inception in 1954,
Austin Radiological Association (ARA Diagnostic Imaging)
has been a cornerstone of healthcare in Central Texas. With a network of 17 state-of-the-art outpatient imaging centers and collaborations with 24 area hospitals, we’re at the forefront of medical imaging in the region. Our partnership with Radiology Partners in 2019 has further enhanced our capabilities in AI technology, expanded our scale, and integrated us into a comprehensive national infrastructure.
What We Offer
:
ARA
is dedicated to providing exceptional career opportunities and keeping our team at the cutting edge of technology. We know the value of work-life balance and are committed to the personal well-being of all our team members.
Here’s why you should join the ARA / RP team
:
Competitive salaries
Advancement opportunities
Comprehensive insurance packages
Wellness programs that include mental health
Flexible scheduling for multiple positions
Access to industry-leading AI-diagnostics
ARA
is seeking a highly motivated
Assistant Clinic Manager
to join our growing team!
Summary
: Under the direction of Clinic Manager, responsible for supervising radiological procedures and staff. Manage the day-to-day activity of patient procedures for site modalities. Plans, organizes, controls, integrates and evaluates the work of assigned staff,
Desired Professional Skills and Experience
:
Bachelor’s Degree in Healthcare Administration, Business or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Three to Five years of healthcare experience; at least Two years supervisory experience preferred.

Competitive salaries

Wellness programs that include mental health
Flexible scheduling for multiple positions
Access to industry-leading AI-diagnostics
ARA
is seeking a highly motivated
Pre-Imaging Services Representative
to join our growing team!
Summary
:
Spends a significant portion of the day communicating directly with customers, via telephone.  Fully engaged in workflow daily to ensure every patient’s journey begins with a meticulously prepared appointment, culminating in exceptional care and prompt imaging results for referring physicians.  Communicates with patients or referring physicians gathering all pertinent data for scheduling and preparing patients to receive their imaging services timely.  Responsible for maintaining confidential records on new and existing patients. Serves as a liaison between patients, referring physicians and the radiologist. This is a medical contact call center.
In order to qualify to work from home (remotely) you must be able to work independently and have high speed cable internet service (50 mbps download and 5 mbps upload) from a reliable cable provider (Satellite internet and mobile hotspots not accepted). Equipment will be provided for you. The VPN device that is provided will need to be connected to an available port on the modem or wireless router.
Desired Professional Skills and Experience
:
High School Diploma or GED.
One to three years of experience in a healthcare or high-volume call center environment and medical terminology experience for radiology procedures preferred.

title: AVP, Finance (Rev Rec)
description_text:
General information

Job Title
AVP, Finance (Rev Rec)
City
Remote
Work Location Type
Remote
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO:
Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, our mission is to transform radiology by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
AVP, FINANCE - POSITION SUMMARY:
Oversees all aspects of revenue recognition processes.
Collaborates with RCM and Accounting teams to accurately record and report revenue.
Prepares and presents executive level presentations.
Leads, mentors, and develops a team of finance professionals.
Develops models and ad hoc analytics to support budgeting, forecasting, and pro forma modeling.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Relevant graduate degree strongly preferred.
5+ years of experience working in healthcare finance and/or RCM experience.
10+ years’ relevant experience,
3+ years’ supervisory experience.
Comprehensive knowledge of financial reporting, analysis, and internal controls.
Knowledge of process improvement methodologies and automation opportunities within finance functions.
WHY RADIOLOGY PARTNERS:
Competitive Benefits package – Eligibility starts the month after hire, with tiered options to choose from.
Compensation Reviews
Career Growth Opportunities
Flexible Remote Schedules
Nashville, TN preferred, not required
Generous PTO Plans and Paid Holidays
Proudly Certified as a Great Place to Work for Five Consecutive Years
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $180,000-$200,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
CCPA Notice
: When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages:
Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking or other financial information in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please email
Talent@radpartners.com
to notify our team.

title: AVP, Outpatient IT Services (Austin, TX)
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
AVP, Outpatient IT Services (Austin, TX)
Functional Area
Teammate - Information Technology
City
Austin
Work Location Type
Hybrid
State
TX
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY:
Radiology Partners has an open position for an AVP of Outpatient IT Services.  The position will report to senior leadership and be responsible for working with many areas within the IT and Clinical teams with a focus on managing all aspects of the Outpatient IT Services Team, including Regional IT Leads at all Practices with significant RP Owned or JV OP volume.   This person is ultimately responsible for the team who maintains the performance and standardization of the RP owned Radiology Information System (RIS), Online Scheduling, CDS and other OP specific applications as required. The Sr. Director of OP Project Management will report to this individual as well.
Looking for candidates located in Austin, TX or Texas.
WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO:
Radiology Partners, through its owned and affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, our mission is to transform radiology by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
WHY RADIOLOGY PARTNERS
Competitive Benefits package – Eligibility starts the month after hire, with tiered options to choose from.
Compensation Reviews, Career Growth Opportunities
Flexible Remote Schedules
Generous PTO Plans and Paid Holidays
Proudly Certified as a Great Place to Work for Five Consecutive Years
POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
General
Responsible for developing strong relationships with RP OP Ops leaders, practice directors, Radiologists and, at all levels of the organization, able to effectively communicate the goals and objectives of the Outpatient IT team •
Provide regular analytical updates to all interested parties  •
Manage completion of all practice inquiries •
Create, develop, and deliver performance improvement plans •
Develop a mutually beneficial relationship with the JV’s and clients to which RP provides IT services •
Oversee and track their understanding of monthly strategic objectives •
Plan and set the available IT resources, onsite resources and support to complete identified project or process improvement •
Coordinate upgrades, change of equipment (access, training, and introduction to services) •
Escalation point for the market of any concerns, requests or work not being managed by IT in a timely manner. •
Interfacing with the Innovation Team and other RP IT Service Lane Leaders within Information Technology and various internal constituencies to bring leading edge technology solutions to bear for key clients. •
Oversees the team that ensures that systems, solutions and processes are in place to meet the needs of internal and external clients. •
Coordinates with the full RP IT team to ensure that the IT needs of the outpatient centers are met •
Is an escalation point for IT issues as presented by Outpatient IT senior leaders •
All duties as assigned in alignment with skills and expertise  •
Travel up to 25%, as needed.
Application Growth and Performance
Oversee and ensure OP Application team is performing application maintenance and upgrades
Accountable for the roll out of new sites
Work with staff to develop estimates for migrations and conversions
Identifies enhancements to known solutions within the knowledge base.
Develops and prioritizes service improvement projects.
Identifies and plans for the standardization and development of National OP application best practices across RP
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Looking for candidates located in Austin, TX or Texas.
Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Health Information Systems or related field preferred; 5+ years of diverse IT experience; 5–7 years managing medium–large IT or business projects, ideally in outpatient radiology.
Clinical Workflow & Systems Knowledge:
Ability to facilitate working sessions, document workflows, gather requirements, and work with physicians and support staff; plus experience with HL7, PACS, voice recognition systems, healthcare workflows, and process flow documentation.
Customer & Stakeholder Focus:
Proven ability to understand customer needs, gather stakeholder insights, and develop effective IT strategies and solutions.
Work Style & Professional Traits:
Strong work ethic, self-starter, able to work independently or on a diverse team; detail-oriented and organized with a talent for identifying improvement opportunities; positive attitude, honesty, and integrity.
Communication & Leadership:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong interpersonal skills to ensure alignment with organizational strategy and lead teams effectively.
Technical & Analytical Skills:
Experience managing clinical application projects; ability to define application requirements and evaluate vendor offerings; adaptable to new technologies.
Project Management Tools:
Proficient with project plans, work breakdown structures, risk analysis, issue tracking, testing plans, communication plans, and similar project-specific tools.
Work Conditions:
Able to work flexible hours across time zones; primarily remote work with travel to RP/client sites as needed; performs other duties as required.
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $190,000.00 - $230,000.00. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
CCPA Notice: When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify
.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages: Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking or other financial information in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please email
Talent@radpartners.com
to notify our team.
Back to job list
Apply

title: Body & Cardiothoracic Radiologist - Radiology Associates of South Florida
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Body & Cardiothoracic Radiologist - Radiology Associates of South Florida
City
Miami
Work Location Type
On-site
State
FL
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
Position Summary
Due to practice growth, Radiology Associates of South Florida, a large multi-specialty radiology practice in Miami, FL, is seeking a body fellowship trained board certified/eligible Radiologist with expertise in Cardiothoracic imaging, oncologic imaging, body MRI and US to join a team-orientated practice dedicated to providing a full range of high-quality imaging and professional radiology services. The primary focus with consist of Body Imaging (cross-sectional CT and MRI), with also experience in Cardio-thoracic Imaging (including Cardiac CT and Cardiac MRI) and excluding Mammography, MSK and Neuro-Imaging. Part-time and full-time opportunities are available with flexible clinical scheduling.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
RASF is one of the largest and most stable fully subspecialized radiology practices in the country, serving the largest health care system in the Miami area and South Florida for 60 years. As a top Cardiovascular Center, Miami Cardiac and Vascular Institute, and with its relationship with the Miami Cancer Institute, RASF delivers the highest quality sub-specialty care using state-of-the-art equipment.
With miles of sandy beaches, South Florida offers unlimited outdoor entertainment in a beautiful tropical setting. Residents enjoy water activities, golf, professional and recreational sports and a diverse nightlife. The area has endless cultural attractions, including art galleries, museums, world-class restaurants and designer shopping. Choose to live close to the beach or in one of South Florida’s exclusive suburban neighborhoods.  Enjoy many recreational activities – including Disney World, Cape Canaveral, the Everglades, South Beach, the Florida Keys and Busch Gardens – all within a few hours’ drive. The area has an excellent public and private school system and no state income tax.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
Fellowship-trained in Body Imaging, Cardio-Thoracic Imaging or Abdominal Imaging
FL licensed or the ability to obtain a FL license required
American Board of Radiology or AOBR certified or Board-Eligible
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $500,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
For More Information Or To Apply:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Katherine Brantley at
recruiting@radpartners.com
, or 704-569-5055.
RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion, and a healthy respect for differences.

E-Verify.

:

Partner radiologist opportunity in Columbus, OH. Subspecialists in
Body Imaging
are encouraged to apply. The ideal candidate must be proficient in general diagnostic imaging with a focus on body imaging and demonstrate a strong desire to work in a collaborative environment with local referring physicians in a team-oriented environment.
Competitive starting annual compensation (
inclusive of 401K profit sharing contribution)
1-Yr Partnership track including Radiology Partners Equity (Associate role available as well)
Commencement bonus
11 Weeks PTO
Full benefits
Accelerated leadership opportunities

CRC is committed perpetual improvement through new clinical initiatives, research, artificial intelligence, and best practices that provide proven value to patients and payors.
CRC operates an internal 24/7 Results Communication Center support team, “CORE” (Center of Radiology Excellence) to coordinate care and clinical contact. This clinical team is an extension of our Radiologists, which helps in reducing day to day administrative minutiae. Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Radiology Alliance is seeking a
Body PET/CT Imaging Radiologist
to support our Outpatient Tennessee PET Scan Center in Murfreesboro, TN. This position will focus on 100% Body – PET/CT scans. The average volume per shift is 30 CTs and 10 PET scans. The ideal candidate will have a strong desire to work in a collaborative environment with the local surgeons, pathologists, and oncologists. Experience working with cancer center treatment centers is a plus.
Full-time median partner compensation. All opportunities come with incentive bonus options. Full-time employees are also eligible for a generous commencement bonus and a comprehensive benefits package. This includes immediate vesting in a 401(k) profit-sharing plan, substantial time off, as well as health, life, disability, and malpractice insurance coverage. Additionally, we offer an internal moonlighting program with exceptional flexibility, enabling radiologists to work remotely from home as much or as little as they choose.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners covers 13 hospitals and 17 imaging centers across Middle Tennessee and Southern Kentucky.
Our collaborative approach ensures outstanding patient care through shared resources and staffing, while also providing incoming provider candidates the flexibility to customize their roles to match their personal goals and preferences. Joining this team means becoming part of a well-supported, physician-led, and highly collegial group!
Nashville, TN has been voted one of the best places to live in the United States and one of the best places to retire by U.S. News, there is always something to do here. Famous for its vibrant country music scene, spicy hot chicken, lively nightlife, affordable cost of living, lack of state income tax, and expanding job market, this dynamic city is attracting people in droves. Residents and visitors alike enjoy a vast amount of fun and entertainment year-round, including an abundance of parks, waterways, recreational areas, and a thriving arts and cultural scene. The city has many major and minor league sports teams, and there are several opportunities for higher education through such institutions as Vanderbilt University and Tennessee State University.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Fellows and Residents welcome to apply
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy, and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
Board certified/eligible by the American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
Licensed in or have the ability to be licensed in the state of TN and KY
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $600,000-$900,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

This includes immediate vesting in a 401(k) profit-sharing plan, substantial time off, as well as health, life, disability, and malpractice insurance coverage. Additionally, we offer an internal moonlighting program with exceptional flexibility, enabling radiologists to work remotely from home as much or as little as they choose. LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW Radiology Partners covers 13 hospitals and 17 imaging centers across Middle Tennessee and Southern Kentucky. Our collaborative approach ensures outstanding patient care through shared resources and staffing, while also providing incoming provider candidates the flexibility to customize their roles to match their personal goals and preferences. Joining this team means becoming part of a well-supported, physician-led, and highly collegial group! Nashville, TN has been voted one of the best places to live in the United States and one of the best places to retire by U.S. News, there is always something to do here. Famous for its vibrant country music scene, spicy hot chicken, lively nightlife, affordable cost of living, lack of state income tax, and expanding job market, this dynamic city is attracting people in droves. Residents and visitors alike enjoy a vast amount of fun and entertainment year-round, including an abundance of parks, waterways, recreational areas, and a thriving arts and cultural scene. The city has many major and minor league sports teams, and there are several opportunities for higher education through such institutions as Vanderbilt University and Tennessee State University. DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Fellows and Residents welcome to apply Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy, and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology Board certified/eligible by the American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology Licensed in or have the ability to be licensed in the state of TN and KY COMPENSATION: The salary range for this position is $600,000-$900,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY: For inquiries about this position, please contact Adam Meyer at recruiting@radpartners.com or 804-486-6754. RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve. Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences. Radiology Partners participates in E-verify . CCPA Notice: When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History. Beware of Fraudulent Messages: Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team at recruiting@radpartners.com .

Position Description & Requirements
Position Summary
Due to practice growth, Radiology Associates of South Florida, a large multi-specialty radiology practice in Miami, FL, is seeking a body fellowship trained board certified/eligible Radiologist with expertise in Body MRI and US to join a team-orientated practice dedicated to providing a full range of high-quality imaging and professional radiology services. The primary focus with consist of Body Imaging (cross-sectional CT and MRI), with experience in Cardio-thoracic Imaging (including Cardiac CT and Cardiac MRI) and excluding Mammography, MSK and Neuro-Imaging. Part-time and full-time opportunities are available with flexible clinical scheduling.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
RASF is one of the largest and most stable fully subspecialized radiology practices in the country, serving the largest health care system in the Miami area and South Florida for 60 years. As a top Cardiovascular Center, Miami Cardiac and Vascular Institute, and with its relationship with the Miami Cancer Institute, RASF delivers the highest quality sub-specialty care using state-of-the-art equipment.
With miles of sandy beaches, South Florida offers unlimited outdoor entertainment in a beautiful tropical setting. Residents enjoy water activities, golf, professional and recreational sports and a diverse nightlife. The area has endless cultural attractions, including art galleries, museums, world-class restaurants and designer shopping. Choose to live close to the beach or in one of South Florida’s exclusive suburban neighborhoods.  Enjoy many recreational activities – including Disney World, Cape Canaveral, the Everglades, South Beach, the Florida Keys and Busch Gardens – all within a few hours’ drive. The area has an excellent public and private school system and no state income tax.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy and residency trained in the practice of diagnostic radiology
Fellowship-trained in Body Imaging, Cardio-Thoracic Imaging or Abdominal Imaging
FL licensed or the ability to obtain a FL license required
American Board of Radiology or AOBR certified or Board-Eligible
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $500,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Western Colorado Radiologic Associates, a dynamic, collegial private practice, seeks a fellowship trained BC/BE radiologist to join an 11-person group of fellowship trained radiologists.  Ideal candidates will be trained in MSK or Body Imaging. Experience in breast imaging and breast procedures, while not required, would be a plus.
Our growing practice is based at a 310-bed level II trauma center and nearby outpatient imaging center. The ideal candidate will be experienced in the entire spectrum of MSK diagnosis and/or Body Imaging diagnosis and procedures and capable of and interested in general diagnostic radiology and call. Remuneration, vacation, and benefits are competitive; with a
signing bonus, one-year partnership track and ample vacation time as a partner.
Excellent      work/life balance with plentiful time off
Highly Competitive      Compensation package with a sign on bonus
Partnership      Track
Leadership      opportunities
On-site position
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Grand Junction is an under the radar outdoor recreational mecca on the Western Slope of the Rockies, 25 miles east of the Utah border and halfway between Denver and Salt Lake City. We enjoy great year-round weather and close proximity to world class skiing (Vail, Aspen, Telluride, Steamboat, Crested Butte), mountain and road biking, kayaking, climbing, hunting, and fishing.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Residency training in Diagnostic Radiology from an ACGME accredited U.S. training program
Fellowship training in Musculoskeletal or Body Imaging
Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology (ABR) or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (AOBR)
Licensed or has the ability to obtain a license in the state of Colorado
Proficiency in General Diagnostic Radiology and willingness to share call
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $450,000-$500,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

PRACTICE OVERVIEW
Founded in 1946, Columbus Radiology Corporation is one of the largest and fastest growing practices in the country, now with 160+ board-certified and subspecialty trained radiologists who are committed to excellence – in patient care, physician relations, quality improvement and professional development. CRC is locally led and managed by CRC radiologists, committed to creative clinical and operational initiatives, artificial intelligence, flexibility and best practices that provide proven value to patients, providers and payors.
CRC operates an internal 24/7 Results Communication Center support team, “CORE” (Center of Radiology Excellence) to coordinate care and clinical contact. This clinical team is an extension of our Radiologists, helping to reduce day to day administrative minutiae. The Advisory Board Company and the American College of Radiology have both recognized this as an innovative customer service function.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Licensed or able to be licensed in the state of Ohio
Board certified or Board eligible in Diagnostic Radiology by the American Board of Radiology
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $400,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. Radiology Associates of South Florida
, a large, fully subspecialized radiology practice based in Miami, FL, is seeking a

with expertise in

LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
RASF is one of the largest and most stable radiology practices in the United States, serving Baptist Health of South Florida, the leading healthcare system in the Miami area. Our radiologists are integral members of the highly regarded Miami Cancer Institute, as well as Miami Cardiac and Vascular Institute and other centers of clinical excellence within the health system.
We deliver the highest quality sub-specialty care using state-of-the-art imaging equipment and a highly skilled technical staff.
With miles of sandy beaches, year-round sunshine, and a vibrant, cosmopolitan atmosphere, South Florida offers an ideal balance of professional opportunity and quality of life. The region boasts excellent public and private schools, abundant recreational and cultural amenities, and no state income tax—making it a great place to live and raise a family.

•
Doctor of Medicine (MD) or Doctor of Osteopathy (DO) degree
•
Completion of a Diagnostic Radiology residency
•
Fellowship training in Body Imaging or Abdominal Imaging
•
Florida medical license (or eligibility to obtain one)
•
ABR or AOBR certification (or board-eligible status)

metadata.Position Description & Requirements: POSITION SUMMARY Radiology Associates of South Florida , a large, fully subspecialized radiology practice based in Miami, FL, is seeking a Body Imaging fellowship-trained, board-certified (or board-eligible) Radiologist with expertise in Body Imaging and Ultrasound to join our team-oriented group dedicated to delivering high-quality, comprehensive imaging services. The primary responsibilities for this position include interpreting Diagnostic Ultrasound, Body MRI, and Body CT , with additional opportunities to read General Diagnostic Radiology (excluding Mammography). Full-time and part-time positions are available with flexible scheduling options. For those interested in academic engagement, there are opportunities to participate in teaching and scholarly activities, including involvement with a new Radiology Residency Program launching in July 2026 . Qualified candidates may also be eligible for an academic appointment at Florida International University . Learn more about our practice at www.rasf.net LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW RASF is one of the largest and most stable radiology practices in the United States, serving Baptist Health of South Florida, the leading healthcare system in the Miami area. Our radiologists are integral members of the highly regarded Miami Cancer Institute, as well as Miami Cardiac and Vascular Institute and other centers of clinical excellence within the health system. We deliver the highest quality sub-specialty care using state-of-the-art imaging equipment and a highly skilled technical staff. With miles of sandy beaches, year-round sunshine, and a vibrant, cosmopolitan atmosphere, South Florida offers an ideal balance of professional opportunity and quality of life. The region boasts excellent public and private schools, abundant recreational and cultural amenities, and no state income tax—making it a great place to live and raise a family. title: Breast Imager - Part time - Bethesda Radiology Associates
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Breast Imager - Part time - Bethesda Radiology Associates
City
Boynton Beach
Work Location Type
On-site
State
FL
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION highlights
Fellowship trained Breast Imager needed for 100% Breast Volume
Enjoy Flexible Scheduling - Choose your own schedule
No Weekends | No Nights
Partnership track available
Monday - Friday; No Nights No Weekends
Onsite with hybrid flexibility
Single Health System - Baptist Health South Florida
Professional Advancement Opportunities
POSITION SUMMARY
Bethesda Radiology Associates is seeking a
fellowship trained Woman’s Imager
to join our Mammography division. As part of a dynamic, multi-specialty practice, you will work alongside a team of exceptional professionals, providing high-quality imaging services to Baptist Health South Florida, one of the nation’s leading healthcare systems. This partnership allows you to be an integral part of a team that delivers exceptional patient care across multiple facilities, including the Baptist Health System’s hospitals and outpatient imaging centers.
This role offers a flexible schedule and a work-life balance that enhances both personal and professional fulfillment. You will benefit from a seamless workflow with a single hospital PACS system, supported by a 24/7 dedicated hospital-based call center for radiology services.
The ideal candidate will be fellowship-trained in mammography and comfortable reading across a full spectrum of breast imaging, including 3D mammography, breast MRI, ultrasound, and image-guided minimally invasive breast procedures. Our practice is committed to providing state-of-the-art diagnostic imaging with an integrated hospital PACS technology and a supportive team environment. Flexible schedule options and additional opportunities to moonlight. Professional growth opportunities also available to serve as the Medical Director for our Woman’s Center.
As a member of Bethesda Radiology Associates, you will play a vital role in contributing to the outstanding care provided by Baptist Health South Florida, ensuring that patients receive the highest standard of imaging services with cutting-edge technology.
Community Overview
Nestled in the heart of Palm Beach County, Boynton Beach offers the perfect balance of coastal living and modern convenience. With year-round sunshine, pristine beaches, and abundant opportunities for boating, golfing, and outdoor recreation, the area is an ideal destination for those who enjoy an active lifestyle.
Beyond its natural beauty, Boynton Beach is a vibrant and welcoming community with a flourishing arts and cultural scene, a diverse selection of dining and shopping, and family-friendly amenities. Residents benefit from excellent schools, safe neighborhoods, and a strong sense of community connection.  Its central location provides easy access to the neighboring hubs of West Palm Beach, Delray Beach, and Fort Lauderdale, as well as to world-class shopping, entertainment, and international airports.
Whether you’re seeking a relaxed coastal lifestyle, a thriving professional community, or a great place to raise a family, Boynton Beach offers an exceptional quality of life in one of Florida’s most desirable regions. Explore Boynton Beach and nearby Delray Beach to see all that this dynamic community has to offer.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Residency training in Diagnostic Radiology from  a ACGME accredited U.S. training program
Board eligible or certified by the American Board of      Radiology (ABR) or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (AOBR)
Fellowship Training in Breast Imaging Preferred
MQSA Required
Florida license or the ability to obtain a Florida license required
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $350,000-$475,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc.
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Katherine Brantley at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or 704-569-5055.
RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer.
RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify.

Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team at

Among them, HCA Florida Lawnwood Hospital stands out as a leading teaching facility and a vital healthcare hub in the area. This 398-bed acute-care hospital provides a comprehensive range of medical services, including a 41-bed emergency department that handles approximately 80,000 visits annually.
Nestled along Florida's picturesque Treasure Coast, Fort Pierce is a vibrant community brimming with old-Florida charm and lush tropical beauty. Located about 120 miles north of Miami, this coastal gem offers a colorful and thriving downtown with a scenic marina and riverfront attractions.

description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Breast Imager - Radiology Partners Indiana-Western
Functional Area
Clinical - Breast
City
Lafayette
Work Location Type
Hybrid
State
IN
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners, Indiana (RP IN WIR) is a 40 member sub-specialized, diversified, state of the art private radiology practice located in Lafayette, Indiana, just 30-60 minutes from Indianapolis. We serve
Franciscan Alliance,
the second largest health care delivery system in Indiana with 7 hospitals and multiple outpatient imaging centers, in a
Tort Reform state
.
Radiology Partners Indiana-WIR is seeking a Board Certified/Board Eligible
Breast Imager
for our Western Indiana location with priority given to fellowship trained radiologist in
Breast
.  This is a full-time, hybrid day position with no weekend or holiday duty covering 100% breast, 3 Days onsite and 2 Days Remote. We perform all modalities including MRI, CT, 3D Mammography, breast ultrasound, MRI-guided biopsies, Stereotactic, general ultrasound, bone density and general x-ray. There is a strong emphasis on women’s imaging inclusive of interventional breast procedures.  Lafayette,
home of Purdue
, is located 30-60 minutes from Indianapolis and just 2 hours to Chicago, which allows great flexibility to live in or near the city.
POSITION SUMMARY
Full      Time Hybrid Day position M-F 8am-5pm EST (Flexible)
3      Days Onsite | 2 Days Remote* (rotating)
No      weekend/No Holidays
No      Call
100%      Breast Imaging only
Additional      Support provided by other Breast Imagers
Candidates      must be proficient in all aspects of Breast Imaging including breast      procedures
Ability      to read MRI Breast required
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Candidates must be a      Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy, Board-certified and residency trained in      the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
Board certified/eligible by      American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology      or Board certified in Diagnostic Radiology
Fellowship training in Breast      Imaging Preferred
Must      be MSQA Certified Required
Ability to secure an Indiana      License
Engage      with and support the needs of the referring physicians
Maintain      a culture that provides quality outcomes
NEW Grads Welcome!
J1 Candidates Welcome!
BENEFITS
Competitive Salary
Generous PTO – 10 Weeks
Ideal work/ life balance
One year partnership track position-No Buy In
Fantastic Leadership - Physician led and governed practice – 40 Radiologists strong
Commencement bonus
Productivity Bonus Available
Relocation Assistance Available
Additional internal moonlighting available
Fellowship Stipends available
Full coverage benefits package including Health, Vision, Dental, Retirement Plans and Malpractice coverage and other covered expenses
Tort Reform State
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $500,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact
Allison Mandal at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or 813-658-5872

Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer.

.

notify our Recruiting Team at

.

Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
CRC is seeking a full-time, fellowship trained (mini-fellowship is acceptable)
General + Breast Imaging Radiologist
based in the greater Columbus, OH region.  This candidate must be proficient in all aspects of breast imaging including breast interventions. Our ideal candidate will be capable of reading non-subspeciality diagnostic imaging and maintain a desire to work in a collaborative environment with local referring physicians.
Competitive starting compensation (inclusive of annual 401K profit sharing contribution)
200 Shifts (inclusive evening & overnight shifts equal to CRC partners)
1-year partnership track including Radiology Partners Equity (associate role available as well)
Commencement bonus
Retention bonus at 18-months
11 Weeks PTO
Full benefits
Accelerated leadership opportunities
All roles with CRC offer substantial moonlighting and incentive pay opportunities
PRACTICE OVERVIEW
Physician Owned. Physician Led.
Founded in 1946, Columbus Radiology Corporation is the fifth largest and one of the fastest growing practices in the country, now with 160+ board-certified and subspecialty trained radiologists who are committed to excellence – in patient care, physician relations, continuous quality improvement and professional development. CRC is committed perpetual improvement through new clinical initiatives, research, artificial intelligence, and best practices that provide proven value to patients and payors.
CRC operates an internal 24/7 Results Communication Center support team, “CORE” (Center of Radiology Excellence) to coordinate care and clinical contact. This clinical team is an extension of our Radiologists, which helps in reducing day to day administrative minutiae. The Advisory Board Company and the American College of Radiology have both recognized this as an innovative customer service function.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Licensed or able      to be licensed in the state of Ohio
Board certified      or Board eligible in Diagnostic Radiology by the American Board of      Radiology
This      position is heavily concentrated on Breast Imaging and Procedures
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $400,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
For More information or to apply:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Mika Nelson at
recruiting@radpartners.com
