title: Breast Radiologist - Boca Radiology Group
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Breast Radiologist - Boca Radiology Group
City
Boca Raton
Work Location Type
On-site
State
FL
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
Position Summary
Boca Radiology Group (BRG) is a 50 person sub-specialized, diversified, state of the art private practice in sunny southeast Florida covering a tertiary 400 bed hospital with Level 3 ED, 11 outpatient imaging centers and teleradiology sites. The group prides itself on being at the forefront of new procedures and technology including seven 3.0 Tesla MRI machines, specialized MARS techniques, DECT, and SPECT-CT.
Visit us at
https://bocaradiology.com/
BRG is seeking an ABR BE/BC Full-time
Breast Imaging Radiologist
to join our team-orientated practice dedicated to providing a full range of high-quality imaging and professional radiology services in Palm Beach County, FL. The ideal candidate
.
will be proficient with breast procedures, diagnostic mammography, ultrasound, MRI, and radiography.  This opportunity offers a flexible clinical schedule and general call is shared amongst the practice (1 weekend day shift every 5 weeks).
The Women’s Health and Wellness Institute is a National Breast Center of Excellence located on the campus of Boca Raton Regional Hospital and allows radiologists the opportunity to practice at the leading edge of breast imaging. Candidates will participate in multimodality clinics, get to practice new imaging techniques such as CESM and have the opportunity to participate in research projects should they choose to.
Compensation and benefits are highly competitive. Be a part of the most technologically advanced imaging team in Palm Beach County!  Relocation support available. Candidates can have the ability to live where other people vacation.
POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Schedule: Onsite M-F
Shift: 8am-5pm EST
Call Requirement: 10* shifts per year
100% Breast
Ability to perform all breast procedures, diagnostic mammography, ultrasound, MRI, and radiography
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Board certified or Board Eligible by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
Fellowship in Breast Imaging is Required
MQSA certified is highly Preferred
Fellows and Residents welcome to Apply
Ability to obtain a Florida license is Required
BENEFITS
Competitive Compensation
Partnership track position
Additional Moonlighting available
Relocation Assistance Available
Full Coverage Benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, 401K, Medical Malpractice Insurance
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $400,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Katherine Brantley at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or 704-569-5055.
COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Nestled in South Florida’s stunning Palm Beach County, Boca Raton is the epitome of upscale coastal living. Known for its pristine beaches, lush parks, and year-round sunshine, this vibrant city offers an unparalleled quality of life.
Boca Raton boasts world-class dining, shopping, and cultural attractions, including the Mizner Park district and the Boca Raton Museum of Art. Its top-rated schools, safe neighborhoods, and abundant recreational activities make it a prime choice for families and professionals alike.
Conveniently located near Miami and Fort Lauderdale, Boca Raton combines the charm of a beach town with the sophistication of a cosmopolitan city. Make Boca Raton your home and experience the perfect blend of elegance, community, and coastal beauty!
RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion, and a healthy respect for differences.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify
.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages:
Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment.  All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team at
recruiting@radpartners.com
.

title: Breast Radiologist - Empire State Radiology/St. Barnabas
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Breast Radiologist - Empire State Radiology/St. Barnabas
Functional Area
Clinical - Breast
City
The Bronx
Work Location Type
On-site
State
NY
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Radiology Partners is seeking a BE/BC Breast Radiologist in Bronx, NY.  The ideal candidate will have the ability to read all Breast interpretations for their state-of-the-art Breast Center of Excellence.  We have an established infra-structure for efficient, collaborative workflow throughout our practice.
The shift is M-F, 8A-5P with no call, no nights, and no weekends for 100% breast imaging. This position can be hybrid with 3 days onsite and 2 days remote.
For this position we offer a highly competitive salary, sign on/retention bonus, generous time off, a relocation package and a full complement of benefits to include 401K. Partnership is available after two years.
Moonlighting opportunities offer additional compensation.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Empire State Radiology (ESR), an affiliate of Radiology Partners, is one of the leading radiology practices in New York. The state-of-the-art department includes diagnostic radiologic, fluoroscopic equipment; mammography; multislice CT scan; MRI; real-time ultrasonography; nuclear medicine; stereotactic and ultrasound localized breast biopsy; PET-CT; and bone densitometry equipment; as well as complete body interventional services with CT, fluoroscopic and ultrasound-guided procedures.  ESR physicians are board certified with subspecialties in Neuroradiology, Musculoskeletal, Pediatrics and Women's Diagnostic Imaging.  ESR has a commitment to quality and ardently promotes and invests in the professional development of our radiologists through a comprehensive quality assurance program.  We offer a very generous compensation package, abundance of vacation, health, life, disability, and malpractice insurance coverage.  Moonlighting opportunities offer additional compensation.
Bronx county is the third most densely populated county in the U.S., separated from Manhattan by the Harlem River and is the only district in New York located on the mainland.  It is home to the Poe Cottage, the New York Botanical Garden, the Bronx Zoo and Yankee Stadium, as well as well as arts and entertainment such as off-Broadway shows. This family-friendly community offers a variety of activities and seasonal amenities for all to enjoy, including Orchard Beach and City Island.   The Bronx school district is very diverse, allowing families the freedom to find the educational option that best fits their needs. While many choose to go with the city’s strong public school system, the Bronx is also home to charter schools, college prep academies, and schools for the arts.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Fellows      and residents welcome to apply
Board      eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology or the American      Osteopathic Board of Radiology
Licensed      in NY or have the ability to obtain a NY Medical License
MQSA      is required
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $5000,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Michelle Spranger at
recruiting@radpartners.com
.

As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Bronx county is the third most densely populated county in the U.S., separated from Manhattan by the Harlem River and is the only district in New York located on the mainland.  It is home to the Poe Cottage, the New York Botanical Garden, the Bronx Zoo and Yankee Stadium, as well as well as arts and entertainment such as off-Broadway shows. This family-friendly community offers a variety of activities and seasonal amenities for all to enjoy, including Orchard Beach and City Island.   The Bronx school district is very diverse, allowing families the freedom to find the educational option that best fits their needs. While many choose to go with the city’s strong public school system, the Bronx is also home to charter schools, college prep academies, and schools for the arts. DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Fellows      and residents welcome to apply Board      eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology or the American      Osteopathic Board of Radiology Licensed      in NY or have the ability to obtain a NY Medical License MQSA      is required COMPENSATION: The salary range for this position is $5000,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY: For inquiries about this position, please contact Michelle Spranger at recruiting@radpartners.com . Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
CRC is seeking a
Part-Time independent contractor
,
BREAST IMAGING proceduralist Radiologist
based in the greater Youngstown, Ohio region. This candidate must be proficient in all aspects of breast imaging including breast interventions. Our ideal candidate will be capable of reading non-subspecialty diagnostic imaging and maintain a desire to work in a collaborative environment with local referring physicians.
W2
or
Independent contractor opportunity
3 days a week (Tue, Wed, Thur) – 12 weeks off
On-site breast procedures only (no general diagnostic reads required)
Competitve annual compensation
Commencement bonus
Annual retention bonus after completing 24 months
Incentive pay offered for every shift
Ample moonlighting opportunities
PRACTICE OVERVIEW
Physician Owned. Physician Led. Founded in 1946, Columbus Radiology Corporation is the fifth largest and one of the fastest growing practices in the country, now with 160+ board-certified and subspecialty trained radiologists who are committed to excellence – in patient care, physician relations, continuous quality improvement and professional development. CRC is committed perpetual improvement through new clinical initiatives, research, artificial intelligence, and best practices that provide proven value to patients and payors.
CRC operates an internal 24/7 Results Communication Center support team, “CORE” (Center of Radiology Excellence) to coordinate care and clinical contact. This clinical team is an extension of our Radiologists, which helps in reducing day to day administrative minutiae. The Advisory Board Company and the American College of Radiology have both recognized this as an innovative customer service function.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Licensed or able to be licensed in the state of Ohio
Board certified or Board eligible in Diagnostic Radiology by the American Board of Radiology
Fellowship trained Breast Imaging (non-fellowship trained considering pending experience)
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $250,000-$360,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc.

For inquiries about this position, please contact Mika Nelson at

title: Breast Radiologist - Radiology Alliance
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Breast Radiologist - Radiology Alliance
City
Nashville
Work Location Type
On-site
State
TN
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
Position Summary
Radiology Partners is seeking full-time and part-time
Breast Radiologists
to support its practices in the greater Nashville area. All aspects of breast imaging including screening exams are only interpreted by the breast section in our highly subspecialized model. The ideal candidate can expect a heavy concentration in dedicated breast imaging including ultrasound, stereo and MRI guided breast biopsies. A desire to work in a collaborative environment with the local surgeons, pathologists and oncologists is required.
Position Duties and Responsibilities:
Serves as a representative of the practice in the field of Breast Imaging, joining various committees to share subject matter expertise. Primarily responsible for mammography and helping on the general hospital worklist as capacity allows, focusing on US, XR and STAT CT. General diagnostic imaging shifts available at the needs of the practice.
Required:
Able      to read and interpret Tomosynthesis Mammograms (Screening and Diagnostic)
Breast      Procedures: Cyst aspiration, Biopsies (US and Stereotactic guided),      Axillary node biopsy, Wire localization
Women’s      Imaging Ultrasound
Optional and strongly preferred:
Able      to read and interpret Breast MRI
MR      guided biopsies
Lymphoscintigraphy
Full-time median partner compensation. All opportunities come with incentive bonus options. Full-time employees are also eligible for a generous commencement bonus and a comprehensive benefits package. This includes immediate vesting in a 401(k) profit-sharing plan, substantial time off, as well as health, life, disability, and malpractice insurance coverage. Additionally, we offer an internal moonlighting program with exceptional flexibility, enabling radiologists to work remotely from home as much or as little as they choose.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners covers 13 hospitals and 17 imaging centers across Middle Tennessee and Southern Kentucky. Our collaborative approach ensures outstanding patient care through shared resources and staffing, while also providing incoming provider candidates the flexibility to customize their roles to match their personal goals and preferences. Joining this team means becoming part of a well-supported, physician-led, and highly collegial group!
Nashville, TN has been voted one of the best places to live in the United States and one of the best places to retire by U.S. News, there is always something to do here. Famous for its vibrant country music scene, spicy hot chicken, lively nightlife, affordable cost of living, lack of state income tax, and expanding job market, this dynamic city is attracting people in droves. Residents and visitors alike enjoy a vast amount of fun and entertainment year-round, including an abundance of parks, waterways, recreational areas, and a thriving arts and cultural scene. The city has many major and minor league sports teams, and there are several opportunities for higher education through such institutions as Vanderbilt University and Tennessee State University.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Fellows and Residents welcome to apply
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy, and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
A      one-year post residency fellowship in Breast Imaging is required
Board certified/eligible by the American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
Licensed in or have the ability to be licensed in the state of TN and KY
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $600,000-$900,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Adam Meyer at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or 804-486-6754
RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify
.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages:
Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please
notify our Recruiting Team at
recruiting@radpartners.com
.

VISA SPONSORSHIPS AVAILABLE
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Radiology Associates of Canton (RAC) was established in 1971 and serves Aultman Hospital main campus, Aultman Orrville Hospital, Aultman Alliance Community Hospital, Southwest General Hospital and other locations in Cuyahoga, Stark, Tuscarawas, Highland and Wayne Counties.  In addition to interpretive and procedural services, RAC partners with Aultman, Mercy and NEOMED to offer a four-year ACGME accredited residency training program in diagnostic radiology.  We provide a complete learning experience with dedicated instruction in each subspecialty of radiology.  Physician owned and operated; they are committed to providing compassionate, cost-effective, high-quality services.  The group consists of 29 sub-specialized radiologists, PA’s and an RA.

MQSA Certification is a plus

Possess excellent communication skills
Be licensed in the state of OH

description_text:

City
Miami
Work Location Type
On-site
State
FL
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
Position Summary
Radiology Associates of South Florida (RASF) has an opening for a fellowship trained Woman’s Imager to join our team-orientated practice dedicated to providing a full range of high-quality imaging and professional radiology services in Plantation, FL. RASF provides services through 4 hospital-associated sites and 10 outpatient imaging centers, including Miami Cancer Institute where we provide advanced breast imaging and procedures. Our imaging team has expertise in all of Breast Imaging including 3D mammography, breast MRI, ultrasound and all image guided minimally invasive breast procedures.
Enjoy state-of-the-art equipment at all facilities and be a part of a collaborative practice model that allows for support dedicated by subspecialized radiologists. The practice offers a very generous compensation package, PTO, moonlighting opportunities to earn additional compensation and excellent health, life, disability, and malpractice insurance coverage.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
RASF is one of the largest and most stable radiology practices in the country, serving the largest health care system in the Miami area and South Florida for 60 years. As a top Neuroscience Institute, Comprehensive Stroke Center, and with its relationship with the Miami Cancer Institute, RASF delivers the highest quality sub-specialty care using state-of-the-art equipment."
With miles of sandy beaches, South Florida offers unlimited outdoor entertainment in a beautiful tropical setting. Residents enjoy water activities, golf, professional and recreational sports, and a diverse nightlife. The area has endless cultural attractions, including art galleries, museums, world-class restaurants, and designer shopping. Choose to live close to the beach or in one of South Florida’s exclusive suburban neighborhoods.  Enjoy many recreational activities – including Disney World, Cape Canaveral, the Everglades, South Beach, the Florida Keys and Busch Gardens – all within a few hours’ drive. The area has an excellent public and private school system and no state income tax.

MQSA Required
Medical license or the ability to      obtain a medical license in the State of Florida

No call
Radiology Partners offers a highly competitive salary, generous PTO, and a wide range of benefits for individuals and families.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Spokane, WA, located in eastern, Washington, is filled with mid-century architecture, quaint coffee shops and an exciting culinary scene with lots of breweries, wineries and tasting rooms. The city is a haven for outdoor adventure seekers, with abundant unparalleled recreation, a gorgeous landscape, and a beloved riverfront park home to a picturesque waterfall.   There are 76 lakes within an hour’s drive of Spokane.  The city's western suburb of Airway Heights is home to Spokane International Airport, Fairchild Air Force Base, as well as two large casino hotels.  As one of the best places to live in the U.S., locals have access to great education and health care options and a diverse economy that is considered a central hub for the Inland.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Residency training in Diagnostic Radiology from an ACGME accredited U.S. training program
Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology (ABR) or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (AOBR)
Breast/Mammo fellowship preferred
MQSA preferred
Licensed or can obtain a WA license
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $525,000-$600,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

or 513-560-0612

description_text:

Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Robust comprehensive breast      program
5 Breast Centers
Latest Hologic 3D Mammography with      Clarity HD and Quorum
Mammo/Tomo (prone and Affirm,      Ultrasound, and MRI guided biopsies and localizations
Full protocol MRI imaging as well      as Abbreviated MRI for dense breast screening
Close, collaborative relationship with      multiple fellowship trained breast surgeons
Dedicated tracking department and      high-risk breast clinic
Supporting/teaching opportunities      for residency program
Partnership track
Highly competitive compensation
Offering the full complement of benefits
Excellent work/life balance with generous PTO
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners Crossroads is seeking a full-time Board Certified/Eligible, Breast radiologist to join our team in Indianapolis.
Radiology Partners is physician owned and physician led radiology practice in the US and the largest hospital-based radiology practice in the US.  Radiology Partners is expanding our local practice in the Indianapolis, IN area. Our hospital in Indianapolis is a comprehensive network of over 650 primary care and specialty care providers, recognized nationally and internationally. Together with our local healthcare facilities, providers offer health care to residents in 57 counties across the state of Indiana.  With a vision of creating the most desirable multi-specialty group practice in Indiana, we are transforming health care with a Physician-led and provider-driven organization focused on quality patient care and patient satisfaction, while meeting the needs of local communities.
Indianapolis is the 16th largest city in the USA with a population of 887,000 in a central agriculture region exporting $7.4B. It has a modern award-winning airport with over 40 nonstop destinations, or you can learn to fly at one of many flight schools. The region is actively growing with a strong diverse economy of trade, transportation; professional services; education, health services; government; leisure and hospitality. Indianapolis has a strong automotive culture based upon a long history of racing and associated industries. Carmel (a northern suburb) is annually ranked one of the top places to live in the country with a strong educational system. Carmel High School is ranked 245 out of 20,446 high schools in the USA based upon the NICHE scoring. Many outdoor urban and suburban activities are possible in a moderate climate of four family-friendly seasons. Indianapolis is a city built on sports with a strong high school, collegiate and professional teams for all types of enthusiasts. The culinary arts are extensive with over 2200 restaurant choices of all cuisines.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Residency training in Diagnostic Radiology from an ACGME accredited U.S. training program
Fellowship training in Breast Imaging preferred
MQSA preferred
Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology (ABR) or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (AOBR)
IN license or ability to obtain an Indiana license
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $650,000-$800,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
For More information or to apply
For inquiries about this position, please contact Katie Schroeder at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or 217-369-0590.

description_text:

Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION OVERVIEW
Central Indiana Region (CIR), a Radiology Partners practice, is seeking a
F
ellowship Trained Breast Radiologist
to join our growing breast center,
Clara Fairbanks for Women
, in Terre Haute, IN.
We perform all modalities including MRI, CT, 3D Mammography, digital mammography, breast ultrasound, MRI-guided biopsies, Stereotactic biopsy, ultrasound core biopsy, needle localizations, Ductogram, general ultrasound, bone density and general x-ray. There is a strong emphasis on women’s imaging inclusive of interventional breast procedures. The ideal candidate will provide direction in woman’s imaging, engage with, and support the needs of referring physicians and maintain and support quality outcomes.
Enjoy a highly competitive salary with flexible earning capability,
commencement bonus, relocation assistance
, comprehensive benefit package, and malpractice insurance coverage.
PRACTICE OVERVIEW
CIR is a subspecialty practice that provides services for Terre Haute Indiana, a
Tort Reform State,
and the surrounding counties.  The practice serves Union Health - a 380 bed, acute care hospital and level III trauma facility. RP IN-CIR is a boutique sub-specialized, diversified, state of the art private practice.
COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Come and see what the “
Queen City of the Wabash
” has to offer!  Nestled in West Central Indiana, just east of the Illinois border along the Wabash River, Terre Haute is home to Indiana State University and Rose Holman Institute of Technology.  The growing region offers historical and cultural charm and is located just 60 minutes from the Indianapolis area.
POSITION HIGHLIGHTS
100% Breast Position
Schedule: Monday-Friday 8am-5pm EST -
Hybrid Option Available
NO weekends, NO Holidays, No Call Required
Partnership Track – One Year
Generous PTO – 10 weeks
Collaborative Team Environment
Ideal Work/Life Balance
Commencement & relocation bonuses
Productivity Incentives
Internal Moonlighting Opportunities
Competitive Salary
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy, Board-certified and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
Board certified/eligible by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology or Board certified in Diagnostic Radiology
Fellowship in Breast Imaging Required
MQSA Certification Required
Ability to secure an Indiana License
Candidates must be proficient in all aspects of Breast Imaging including breast procedures
Ideal Candidate must be compassionate, team oriented and have strong communication skills
NEW Grads Welcome!
VISA candidates Welcome!
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $500,000-$750,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Radiology Partners is seeking a BC/BE Breast Radiologist for Garnet Health.  The ideal candidate will have the ability to perform breast MRI and procedures including Stereotactic and US Guided Breast Biopsy and Breast Wire Localization. We have an established infra-structure for efficient, collaborative workflow throughout our practice.
We offer a highly competitive salary, commencement bonus and plentiful time off, a relocation package and a full complement of benefits to include 401K. This is a partnership track position.
We offer a very generous compensation package, abundance of vacation, health, life, disability, and malpractice insurance coverage. Moonlighting opportunities offer additional compensation.
Ample opportunities for teaching and working with      residents, if desired, 1 week rotation for residents
2-year partnership track position
Work with highly experienced techs, state-of-the-art      equipment, and strong culture to immerse yourself in with supportive and      collegial referring clinicians
Excellent Compensation and Benefits, 9 weeks PTO
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Empire State Radiology (ESR), an affiliate of Radiology Partners, is one of the leading radiology practices in NY covering all 5 boroughs. ESR has over 30 physicians (and growing!) and provides radiology services for Garnett Health and Metro Hudson.  ESR physicians are board certified with subspecialties in IR, Neuroradiology, Musculoskeletal, Pediatrics and Women's Diagnostic Imaging. ESR has a commitment to quality and ardently promotes and invests in the professional development of our radiologists through a comprehensive quality assurance program.  We offer a very generous compensation package, abundance of vacation, health, life, disability and malpractice insurance coverage.
KEY ITEMS
Commencement      Bonus
Teaching opportunity with residents (if desired)
Partnership      track position
Work with      highly experienced techs, state-of-the-art equipment and strong culture to      immerse yourself in with supportive and collegial referring clinicians.
Excellent      Compensation and Benefits
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Residency      training in Diagnostic Radiology from an ACGME accredited U.S. training      program
Board      eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology (ABR) or the American      Osteopathic Board of Radiology (ABOR)
Licensed      or ability to obtain a license in the state of New York
MQSA      Certification
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $500,000-$525,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Radiology Partners is seeking a Board Certified/Board Eligible Diagnostic Independent Contractor, Breast Radiologist for a new site in Spokane, WA.
Rockwood Clinic is part of a larger locally owned, not-for-profit health care system, providing care throughout the Inland Northwest.  The Radiology Department provides all aspects of Diagnostic Imaging, Breast and Women’s Imaging and Interventional Radiology.
M-F Days, 8a-5p PST
100% Mammo
Internal Moonlighting opportunities
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Spokane, WA, located in eastern, Washington, is filled with mid-century architecture, quaint coffee shops and an exciting culinary scene with lots of breweries, wineries and tasting rooms. The city is a haven for outdoor adventure seekers, with abundant unparalleled recreation, a gorgeous landscape, and a beloved riverfront park home to a picturesque waterfall.   There are 76 lakes within an hour’s drive of Spokane.  The city's western suburb of Airway Heights is home to Spokane International Airport, Fairchild Air Force Base, as well as two large casino hotels.  As one of the best places to live in the U.S., locals have access to great education and health care options and a diverse economy that is considered a central hub for the Inland.
As a new location for Radiology Partners, we are seeking candidates who enjoy building a practice and establishing relationships with referring clinicians.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Residency training in Diagnostic Radiology from an ACGME accredited U.S. training program
Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology (ABR) or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (AOBR)
Breast/Mammo fellowship preferred
MQSA preferred
Licensed or can obtain a WA license
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $500,000-$550,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc.

For inquiries about this position, please contact

at

title: Breast Radiologist- Rose Imaging Specialists - Austin,TX
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Breast Radiologist- Rose Imaging Specialists - Austin,TX
Functional Area
Clinical - Breast
City
Austin
Work Location Type
On-site
State
TX
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
Position Summary
100%      Breast Imaging and procedures
Be      proficient in all aspects of breast imaging including mammography, breast      US, breast related procedures including breast us biopsies, localization      procedures, and stereotactic biopsies
A proven track record of outstanding      interpersonal and communication skills is expected
Full      Time - 3 or 4 day work week. No call requirements, no night shifts
Competitive      Compensation + Comprehensive Benefits + Paid Malpractice
Fellowship      highly preferred, but not required
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Rose Imaging Specialists has an immediate opening at Austin Breast Imaging in Austin, TX. We are recruiting for an experienced breast radiologist with strong clinical skills. This is a full-Time, 100% Breast position, collegial working environment, working 3 to 4 days per week, with no call and no holidays, while offering generous vacation. ABI is well established in the Austin Area, with an excellent reputation, and strong referral base. We provide personalized care for our patients with physician performed, hand-held ultrasound, and delivery of same-day results for all diagnostic exams. We are highly focused on contrast enhanced mammography. We do not offer breast MRI.
Rose Imaging Specialists is the largest breast-specific imaging group in the United States. We have over 40 board certified breast radiologists that provide breast imaging services to some of the finest outpatient imaging centers in Texas. We practice at the highest level of quality, including the publications of several research papers each year, the development of cutting-edge technologies, such as contrast enhanced mammography and Hologic’s new SmartCurve paddle, and a robust, practice-wide peer review.
Discover the best of Texas living in Austin, a vibrant city where world-class healthcare meets an unbeatable lifestyle. Enjoy year-round sunshine, a thriving food and music scene, endless outdoor activities, and top-rated schools—all in a community known for its innovation and friendly vibe. Whether you’re into live music downtown, paddle boarding on Lady Bird Lake, or exploring Hill Country wineries, Austin offers the perfect balance of career opportunity and quality of life.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or      Osteopathy and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
Board certified by the American Board of Radiology or American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (or board-eligible for recent graduates falling under the new ABR guidelines)
Preferred licensure in Texas or the ability to be Licensed in Texas
MQSA Certified
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $425,000-$550,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. metadata.Job Title: Breast Radiologist- Rose Imaging Specialists - Austin,TX
metadata.Position Description & Requirements: Position Summary 100%      Breast Imaging and procedures Be      proficient in all aspects of breast imaging including mammography, breast      US, breast related procedures including breast us biopsies, localization      procedures, and stereotactic biopsies A proven track record of outstanding      interpersonal and communication skills is expected Full      Time - 3 or 4 day work week. No call requirements, no night shifts Competitive      Compensation + Comprehensive Benefits + Paid Malpractice Fellowship      highly preferred, but not required LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW Rose Imaging Specialists has an immediate opening at Austin Breast Imaging in Austin, TX. We are recruiting for an experienced breast radiologist with strong clinical skills. This is a full-Time, 100% Breast position, collegial working environment, working 3 to 4 days per week, with no call and no holidays, while offering generous vacation. ABI is well established in the Austin Area, with an excellent reputation, and strong referral base. We provide personalized care for our patients with physician performed, hand-held ultrasound, and delivery of same-day results for all diagnostic exams. We are highly focused on contrast enhanced mammography. We do not offer breast MRI. Rose Imaging Specialists is the largest breast-specific imaging group in the United States. We have over 40 board certified breast radiologists that provide breast imaging services to some of the finest outpatient imaging centers in Texas. We practice at the highest level of quality, including the publications of several research papers each year, the development of cutting-edge technologies, such as contrast enhanced mammography and Hologic’s new SmartCurve paddle, and a robust, practice-wide peer review. Discover the best of Texas living in Austin, a vibrant city where world-class healthcare meets an unbeatable lifestyle. Enjoy year-round sunshine, a thriving food and music scene, endless outdoor activities, and top-rated schools—all in a community known for its innovation and friendly vibe. Whether you’re into live music downtown, paddle boarding on Lady Bird Lake, or exploring Hill Country wineries, Austin offers the perfect balance of career opportunity and quality of life. DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or      Osteopathy and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology Board certified by the American Board of Radiology or American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (or board-eligible for recent graduates falling under the new ABR guidelines) Preferred licensure in Texas or the ability to be Licensed in Texas MQSA Certified COMPENSATION: The salary range for this position is $425,000-$550,000. Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Boca Radiology Group (BRG) is a 50 person sub-specialized, diversified, state of the art private practice in sunny southeast Florida covering a tertiary 400 bed hospital with Level 3 ED, 11 outpatient imaging centers and teleradiology sites. The group prides itself on being at the forefront of new procedures and technology including seven 3.0 Tesla MRI machines, specialized MARS techniques, DECT, and SPECT-CT.
Visit us at
https://bocaradiology.com/
BRG is seeking an ABR BE/BC Full-time Breast Imaging Radiologist to join our team-orientated practice dedicated to providing a full range of high-quality imaging and professional radiology services in Palm Beach County, FL. The ideal candidate will be proficient with breast procedures, diagnostic mammography, ultrasound, MRI, and radiography.  This opportunity offers a flexible clinical schedule.
The Women’s Health and Wellness Institute is a National Breast Center of Excellence located on the campus of Boca Raton Regional Hospital and allows radiologists the opportunity to practice at the leading edge of breast imaging. Candidates will participate in multimodality clinics, get to practice new imaging techniques such as CESM and have the opportunity to participate in research projects should they choose to.
Compensation and benefits are highly competitive. Be a part of the most technologically advanced imaging team in Palm Beach County!  Relocation support available. Candidates can have the ability to live where other people vacation.
POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Schedule: Remote: M-F (Flexible Scheduling)
Shift: 8am-5pm EST (Flexible Scheduling)
100% Breast
Comfortable reading across a full spectrum of breast imaging including Diagnostic Mammography, Breast MR, Ultrasound and Radiography
BENEFITS
Competitive Compensation
Competitive Compensation
Partnership track position:
Additional Moonlighting available
Relocation Assistance Available
Full Coverage Benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, 401K, Medical Malpractice Insurance
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Board certified or Board Eligible by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
Fellowship in Breast Imaging is Required
MQSA certified is highly Preferred
Fellows and Residents welcome to Apply
Ability to obtain a Florida license is Required
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $400,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Katherine Brantley at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or call 704-569-5055.

Visit us at https://bocaradiology.com/ BRG is seeking an ABR BE/BC Full-time Breast Imaging Radiologist to join our team-orientated practice dedicated to providing a full range of high-quality imaging and professional radiology services in Palm Beach County, FL. The ideal candidate will be proficient with breast procedures, diagnostic mammography, ultrasound, MRI, and radiography.  This opportunity offers a flexible clinical schedule. The Women’s Health and Wellness Institute is a National Breast Center of Excellence located on the campus of Boca Raton Regional Hospital and allows radiologists the opportunity to practice at the leading edge of breast imaging. Candidates will participate in multimodality clinics, get to practice new imaging techniques such as CESM and have the opportunity to participate in research projects should they choose to. Compensation and benefits are highly competitive. Be a part of the most technologically advanced imaging team in Palm Beach County!  Relocation support available. Candidates can have the ability to live where other people vacation. POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Schedule: Remote: M-F (Flexible Scheduling) Shift: 8am-5pm EST (Flexible Scheduling) 100% Breast Comfortable reading across a full spectrum of breast imaging including Diagnostic Mammography, Breast MR, Ultrasound and Radiography BENEFITS Competitive Compensation Competitive Compensation Partnership track position: Additional Moonlighting available Relocation Assistance Available Full Coverage Benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, 401K, Medical Malpractice Insurance DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Board certified or Board Eligible by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology Fellowship in Breast Imaging is Required MQSA certified is highly Preferred Fellows and Residents welcome to Apply Ability to obtain a Florida license is Required COMPENSATION: The salary range for this position is $400,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY: For inquiries about this position, please contact Katherine Brantley at recruiting@radpartners.com or call 704-569-5055. RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve. Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences. Radiology Partners participates in E-verify. CCPA Notice: When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History. Beware of Fraudulent Messages: Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team at recruiting@radpartners.com.

Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Boca Radiology Group (BRG) is a 50 person sub-specialized, diversified, state of the art private practice in sunny southeast Florida covering a tertiary 400 bed hospital with Level 3 ED, 11 outpatient imaging centers and teleradiology sites. The group prides itself on being at the forefront of new procedures and technology including seven 3.0 Tesla MRI machines, specialized MARS techniques, DECT, and SPECT-CT.
Visit us at
https://bocaradiology.com/
BRG is seeking an ABR BE/BC Full-time Breast Imaging Radiologist to join our team-orientated practice dedicated to providing a full range of high-quality imaging and professional radiology services in Palm Beach County, FL. The ideal candidate will be proficient with breast procedures, diagnostic mammography, ultrasound, MRI, and radiography.  This opportunity offers a flexible clinical schedule.
The Women’s Health and Wellness Institute is a National Breast Center of Excellence located on the campus of Boca Raton Regional Hospital and allows radiologists the opportunity to practice at the leading edge of breast imaging. Candidates will participate in multimodality clinics, get to practice new imaging techniques such as CESM and have the opportunity to participate in research projects should they choose to.
Compensation and benefits are highly competitive. Be a part of the most technologically advanced imaging team in Palm Beach County!  Relocation support available. Candidates can have the ability to live where other people vacation.
POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Schedule: Remote: M-F (Flexible Scheduling)
Shift: 8am-5pm EST (Flexible Scheduling)
100% Breast
Comfortable reading across a full spectrum of breast imaging including Diagnostic Mammography, Breast MR, Ultrasound and Radiography
BENEFITS
Competitive Compensation
Competitive Compensation
Partnership track position:
Additional Moonlighting available
Relocation Assistance Available
Full Coverage Benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, 401K, Medical Malpractice Insurance
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Board certified or Board Eligible by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
Fellowship in Breast Imaging is Required
MQSA certified is highly Preferred
Fellows and Residents welcome to Apply
Ability to obtain a Florida license is Required
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $400,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Katherine Brantley at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or call 704-569-5055.
RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify.

When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages:
Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team at

title: Cardiothoracic Radiologist - Boca Radiology Group
description_text:
General information

Job Title
Cardiothoracic Radiologist - Boca Radiology Group
City
Boca Raton
Work Location Type
On-site
State
FL
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Boca Radiology Group (BRG) is a 40 person sub-specialized, diversified, state of the art private practice in sunny southeast Florida covering a tertiary 400 bed hospital with Level 3 ED, 11 outpatient imaging centers and teleradiology sites. The group prides itself on being at the forefront of new procedures and technology including seven 3.0 Tesla MRI machines, specialized MARS techniques, DECT, and SPECT-CT.
BRG is seeking an ABR BE/BC full-time Cardiothoracic Radiologist to join our team-orientated practice with state-of-the-art imaging equipment. We currently have 13 coronary CT scanners and cardiac MR is performed on 1.5 Tesla and 3 Tesla magnets. The ideal candidate will have strong clinical skills in both thoracic and cardiac imaging and be interested in actively participating in growing the cardiothoracic division.
Qualified applicants should have completed fellowship training in cardiothoracic imaging or have proficient experience in CT cardiac, cardiac MR, CTA angiograms, and comfortable reading body imaging CT and radiography. This is an on-site position with a typical day shift schedule, 8 a.m.-5:30 p.m. Call is 1 weekend day shift per month.
Compensation and benefits are highly competitive. Be a part of the most technologically advanced imaging team in Palm Beach County! Relocation support available. Candidates have the ability to live where other people vacation.
POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Schedule: Onsite M-F
Shift: 8am-5pm EST
Call Requirement: NO OVERNIGHT Responsibility
Proficient in reading cardiothoracic and thoracic imaging including: CT cardiac, cardiac MR, CTA angiograms, body imaging CT and radiography
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Board certified or Board Eligible by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy and residency trained in the practice of Diagnostic Radiology
Fellowship training in Cardiothoracic Imaging Preferred but not required
Proficient experience with reading cardiothoracic imaging required
Ability to obtain a Florida license is required
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $400,000-$1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Katherine Brantley at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or 704-569-5055.
COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Nestled in South Florida's stunning Palm Beach County, Boca Raton is the epitome of upscale coastal living. Known for its pristine beaches, lush parks, and year-round sunshine, this vibrant city offers an unparalleled quality of life.
Boca Raton boasts world-class dining, shopping, and cultural attractions, including the Mizner Park district and the Boca Raton Museum of Art. Its top-rated schools, safe neighborhoods, and abundant recreational activities make it a prime choice for families and professionals alike.
Conveniently located near Miami and Fort Lauderdale, Boca Raton combines the charm of a beach town with the sophistication of a cosmopolitan city. Make Boca Raton your home and experience the perfect blend of elegance, community, and coastal beauty!
RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify
.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages:
Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver's license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team at
recruiting@radpartners.com
.

title: Chief Nuclear Medicine Technologist
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Chief Nuclear Medicine Technologist
Functional Area
Clinical - Nuclear
City
Las Vegas
Work Location Type
On-site
State
NV
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
Join Desert Radiology, Transform your Career and Radiology!
Who We Are
:
Our story began in the early 1950s with Dr. Robert Taylor. By 1966 Dr. Taylor was joined by Dr. Harris Knudson and Dr. James Lum and the 3 formed Taylor, Knudson & Lum. In 1969 Dr. Francis Esposito joined the practice, followed by Dr. Richard Ellis and Dr. Paul Bandt in 1971. By the mid 1970s, the location was expanded and renamed to Desert Radiologists. in 1987 it was relocated to 2020 Palomino Lane, and still operates in this location today. In 2017, the practice name was officially changed to Desert Radiology.
We are also proud to support many local non-profit organizations, including City Impact Center, Project 150, Opportunity Village, the American Lung Association of Southern Nevada, Shriner's Hospital for Children, Veteran's Village, Susan G. Komen, St. Jude's Children Research Hospital and many more. DR also has partnerships with numerous athletic groups such as the Vegas Golden Knights, Las Vegas Aces, Las Vegas Lights FC, Las Vegas Aviators, Las Vegas Raiders, Las Vegas Knight Hawks and many, many more sports teams.
Join the team at Desert Radiology and you will work with some of the healthcare industry’s most innovative minds on high-impact projects designed to move the practice of radiology forward.
What We Offer
:
Radiology is a team sport, and Desert Radiology is building a community of physicians and support teammates who embody our practice values and believe in our bold mission to transform radiology.
Here’s why you should join the Desert Radiology / RP team:
Community presence: 9 imaging centers and 8 hospital affiliations
Leading the pack in the development of AI tools and technology resources
Competitive compensation and benefits
Opportunities for professional development and career growth
Desert Radiology is seeking a skilled patient-focused
Chief Nuclear Medicine Technologist
.
Summary
: The
Chief Nuclear Medicine Technologist
will perform nuclear medicine procedures to assist in the diagnosis of disease or injury. Performs nuclear medicine procedures as prescribed by a physician. Follows established techniques and methods in operating equipment and processing images. Ensures technical quality of images and exercises judgment in processing assigned workload. Assists the Imaging Facility Manager in the coordination of patient care and workflow activities of the specific modality.
Desired Professional Skills and Experience
Current certification in cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) recognized by the American Heart Association
Current American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) or Nuclear Medicine Technology Certification Board (NMTCB) registry (or must be registry-eligible and obtain registry within one year of employment in technologist position)
Ability to start and maintain an IV
Knowledge of nuclear medicine technology principles and procedures, normally acquired through completion of approved nuclear medicine technology training program
The hourly range for this position is
$40.00-$55.00
. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include possible incentive and productivity programs, health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
In June 2019, Desert Radiology (DR) announced the practice partnership with Radiology Partners (RP). Radiology Partners, through its owned and affiliated practices, is a leading physician-led and physician-owned radiology practice in the U.S. Together with Radiology Partners, we are on a mission to transform radiology.
Radiology Partners is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer committed to providing equal opportunities in all our employment practices. The Practice prohibits discrimination, harassment, and retaliation in any form based on race; color; religion; genetic information; national origin; sex; sexual orientation; gender identity and expression; pregnancy; age; disability; citizenship status; veteran status; or any other category protected by federal, state, or local laws.
CCPA Notice
: When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers and (2) Education and Employment History.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify
.
Back to job list
Apply

The Practice prohibits discrimination, harassment, and retaliation in any form based on race; color; religion; genetic information; national origin; sex; sexual orientation; gender identity and expression; pregnancy; age; disability; citizenship status; veteran status; or any other category protected by federal, state, or local laws. CCPA Notice : When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers and (2) Education and Employment History. title: Client Relations Partner
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Client Relations Partner
Functional Area
Teammate - Revenue Cycle
City
Remote
Work Location Type
Remote
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY:
Radiology Partners is seeking a Client Relations Partner accountable for building and managing relationships with client billing teams, managing special projects for Revenue Cycle, and working closely with internal and external billing teams.  Encourages communication in the workflow for continuous improvement. The position will focus on managing relationships with billing teams, reviewing metrics and implementing special projects for Revenue Cycle process improvement.
WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO:
Radiology Partners, through its owned and affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, our mission is to transform radiology by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
WHY RADIOLOGY PARTNERS:
Competitive Benefits package – Eligibility starts the month after hire, with tiered options to choose from.
Compensation Reviews, Career Growth Opportunities
Flexible Remote Schedules
Generous PTO Plans and Paid Holidays
Proudly Certified as a Great Place to Work for Five Consecutive Years
POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage relationships with client billing contacts, serving as the primary point of contact for questions and resolving payment issues.
Review key revenue cycle metrics and collaborate with internal and external billing teams to improve results and implement process improvement initiatives.
Liaise between cross-functional teams to ensure optimal service delivery and client satisfaction.
Coordinate resolution of claims processing and billing issues, ensuring compliance with state and federal laws and regulations.
Lead the development and execution of special projects and the planning and coordination of meetings.
Coordinate resolution of issues and concerns regarding claims processing and billing issues
Maintains knowledge of and ensures compliance with state and federal laws, regulations for Medicare, Medicaid, managed care and other third party payers
Manage multiple clients at once
Works with clients to solve difficult payment problems including claims processing and billing issues across the revenue cycle as well as escalated patient complaints.
Lead the planning and coordination of meetings
Performs other duties as assigned.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
Radiology Revenue Cycle and Billing experience is preferred
Excellent inter-personal, verbal, and written communication skills
Advanced computer skills and proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint required; intermediate skills in MS Word and Outlook required
Demonstrated ability to successfully lead process improvement projects
Excellent relationship building skills and aptitude for working collaboratively with cross-functional groups
Strong communications skills; ability to listen attentively and to communicate information clearly and effectively
Self-starter with high degree of drive, initiative, and follow through
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
B.A. or B.S. in Business Administration or related field preferred.
5+ years of supervisory experience in revenue cycle management in a high-volume environment.
2+ years of experience in an A/R consulting role.
Knowledge of healthcare reimbursement, medical billing, CPT/ICD9/ICD10 coding, and financial reporting.
Proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook.
COMPENSATION
The salary range for this position is $60,000-$70,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
CCPA Notice: When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify
.
.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages: Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking or other financial information in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please email
Talent@radpartners.com
to notify our team.
Back to job list
Apply
