LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
RP Valley is a well-established practice in the Phoenix area. With a history dating back to 1961, we are a sub-specialized group of over 30 radiologists. We provide services at high quality Banner Medical Hospitals in the Phoenix area, servicing 3 hospitals - including Designated Stroke Centers and a Level 1 Trauma Center. In addition, we provide coverage at 12 Outpatient Imaging Centers.
Located in West Phoenix area, our practice offers an outstanding quality of life personally and professionally. The warm climate, diverse recreational activities, vibrant cultural scene, and strong healthcare network create a fulfilling and enriching lifestyle for all who call this area home. See where we work and play!
https://www.visitarizona.com/
.

Licensed or ability to obtain a State of Arizona medical license.

Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology

title: Day General Radiologist with Pediatric Fellowship - Southern Alliance Radiology
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Day General Radiologist with Pediatric Fellowship - Southern Alliance Radiology
City
Columbus
Work Location Type
On-site
State
GA
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Southern Alliance Radiology is seeking a full-time
General Radiologist with a Pediatric Fellowship to join our busy practice in Columbus, GA.
Southern Alliance Radiology services two hospitals in Columbus, Georgia and a state-of-the-art Columbus Children's Hospital that opened in the Fall of 2024. This new facility has the regions only dedicated pediatric program, including a full-service Pediatric Emergency Room and PICU.
Full scope General/Diagnostic      along with Pediatric reads
Support inpatient and community      outpatient pediatric population
Commencement & Productivity      Bonus
Monday-Friday estimated      with Q6 call
Onsite and      Remote options
1 years to      Partnership
Up to 12 weeks      of PTO
1 Hour South      of Atlanta making international traveling easy!
We offer an excellent work-life balance, very competitive compensation, as well as generous benefits including CME allowance, professional licensure, profit sharing/401(k), safe harbor, moving expenses (up to IRS allowable), professional liability, health and dental insurance, as well as life and disability insurance.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Southern Alliance Radiologist is a practice of 15 fellowship trained radiologists in Breast Imaging, Neuroradiology, MSK, and Pediatrics providing support to the Piedmont system.  This is a full-service system, with the Midtown Campus being a 583-bed tertiary hospital and the Northside Campus a 100-bed community campus.
Columbus, Georgia, is a vibrant city located in the western part of the state, along the banks of the Chattahoochee River. Known for its rich history, diverse culture, and southern charm, Columbus has evolved into a thriving community with a mix of tradition and modernity. Whether enjoying outdoor activities along the river, exploring cultural events, or contributing to the local community, residents of Columbus find a welcoming and dynamic environment in which to live and thrive.
Economy:
The city's economy has      diversified over the years, with sectors such as healthcare, education,      and military contributing significantly. Fort Moore, a major U.S. Army      installation, has a significant impact on the local economy. Columbus has      seen ongoing economic development, with efforts to revitalize downtown      areas and attract businesses. The revitalization projects aim to create a      dynamic urban environment while preserving the city's historic character.
Cultural Diversity:
Columbus embraces cultural      diversity, creating a melting pot of traditions and experiences. The city      hosts various cultural events, festivals, and celebrations that showcase      its diverse heritage. Residents take pride in the inclusive and welcoming atmosphere.
Education:
Columbus is home to      reputable educational institutions, including Columbus State University.      The city's commitment to education is evident in its schools, colleges,      and universities, providing residents with access to quality educational      opportunities.
Outdoor Recreation:
Situated along the      Chattahoochee River, Columbus offers a wealth of outdoor recreational      activities. The Columbus Riverwalk is a popular destination for walking,      jogging, and enjoying scenic views. Additionally, the city's parks and      green spaces provide ample opportunities for outdoor enthusiasts.
Arts and Entertainment:
The arts scene in Columbus      is thriving, with venues such as the RiverCenter for the Performing Arts      hosting various performances throughout the year. The Springer Opera      House, one of the oldest theaters in the country, adds a touch of historic      charm to the city's cultural landscape.
Community Engagement:
Columbus fosters a strong      sense of community engagement. Residents actively participate in local      events, volunteer initiatives, and community projects. The city's      leadership encourages civic involvement, making it a place where      individuals can make a positive impact.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Candidates must be a Doctor of      Medicine or Osteopathy, Board-certified and residency trained in the      practice of Diagnostic Radiology
Board certified by American Board      of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology or Board      certified in Diagnostic Radiology
Fellowship training in Pediatrics      required
Fellows are welcome to apply
Licensure or ability to obtain      license in Georgia
Experienced Pediatric Radiologist      but also capable of reading non-subspecialty diagnostic imaging
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $250,000-$550,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY
For inquiries about this position, please contact
recruiting@radpartners.com
or 865-643-9000.
RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-Verify.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages:
Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment.  All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team at

HCA Florida Fawcett Hospital, a 238-bed acute care hospital, supports the community by providing specialty services including cardiology, neurology, gastroenterology, imaging, oncology, orthopedic care, surgery, women's care, wound care and physical therapy and rehabilitation.
Port Charlotte's unspoiled beauty makes it a destination of choice for both Florida residents and vacationers alike. Conveniently located between Sarasota and Fort Myers on Florida’s Gulf Coast, Port Charlotte features more than 165 miles of waterways with access to Charlotte Harbor, Myakka River and the Gulf of Mexico. The area boasts amazing beaches and an abundance of golf courses. World-class sailing, boating, and fishing, unlimited water sports, hiking trails, wildlife viewing and popular kayaking trails such the designated paddling trails of Peace River are right in your backyard.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Candidates must be BC/BE by ABR or AOBR
Fellowship trained in Interventional Radiology preferred
Breast imaging capabilities are not required but a plus
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $550,000-$600,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

: Onsite, remote, or hybrid – we make it work for you
Coverage across
both inpatient and outpatient
settings
Comprehensive
benefits package
including health, dental, vision, retirement, and more
We are currently seeking a skilled and dedicated General Body Radiologist to join our dynamic team in Austin, Texas. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in interpreting various body imaging modalities and be comfortable with light procedures.
Our work environment is designed to be both desirable and efficient, featuring comprehensive support staff, robust IT infrastructure, and the option of private or common reading rooms for after-hours shifts.
If you're ready for a fulfilling role with flexibility, support, and long-term growth in a city that has it all,
apply now
and become part of a practice that values you professionally and personally.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Austin Radiological Association
ARA Diagnostic Imaging (Austin Radiological Association) is a nationally renowned radiology practice with a 70+ year history of providing exceptional service and clinical care to the patients of Austin and Central Texas. We are one of the largest radiology groups in the country, with 110+ radiologists across all subspecialties.
ARA serves 24 hospitals and operates 17 outpatient imaging centers in Central Texas. ARA partners with Dell Medical School at the University of Texas, helping to redefine how diagnostic testing is designed, delivered, and leveraged to improve health. ARA physicians serve as the radiology faculty for University of Texas Dell Medical School. As such, the practice also runs the ACGME residency program and radiologists have opportunities to teach residents, fellows, and medical students. Appointment as Dell Medical School faculty is optional. Qualified candidates may be eligible for protected academic time.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Board
certified or board eligible in Diagnostic Radiology by the American Board of Radiology
Texas License
Radiology fellows and residents are welcome to apply
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $400,000-$450,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

title: Day General/Body/MRI Radiologist working with Residents- Radiology Partners Florida
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Day General/Body/MRI Radiologist working with Residents- Radiology Partners Florida
City
Tampa
Work Location Type
On-site
State
FL
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Radiology Partners is expanding our premier practice to support our exciting growth throughout the state of Florida.  RP Florida is currently seeking a
General Radiologist with Body/MRI
training or experience to join our talented team in the Greater Tampa area. Ideal candidates will be comfortable interpreting a wide range of general diagnostic imaging as well as subspecialty body/MRI studies. Additionally, this position offers the unique opportunity to mentor and educate future radiologists through our established residency program at HCA Florida Trinity.
Opportunity Highlights:
Competitive compensation model with production incentives and opportunity for annual increases
Multiple bonus options available
2-year partnership track
8 weeks of vacation
Daytime shift with no call; Weekends all done remotely (Q8)
Engage in daily clinical education and mentorship of ACGME-accredited radiology residents
Additional moonlighting opportunities available during surge times
Broad diagnostic case mix complemented by body/MRI studies
Fully integrated workstation under RP Cloud Enterprise tech stack; Includes Intelerad PACS,   Clario Worklist, and  PowerScribe dictation software to maximize efficiency and streamline workflows
Continued AI enhancements through platforms and programs such as Aidoc, RecoMD, and Best   Practice Recommendation (BPR) Templates
Comprehensive benefits package offered including malpractice coverage
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
RP Florida serves 8 HCA hospitals and multiple freestanding emergency rooms across the Greater Tampa region and Florida’s Gulf Coast. We provide expertise across all major radiology subspecialties, offering both on-site and remote reading services, along with a variety of procedural cases. Our team-based model fosters exceptional patient care through the strategic use of shared resources, state-of-the-art technology, and comprehensive support at both the national and local levels. By joining this team, you'll become a member of a well-supported, physician-led, and highly collegial group!
Florida offers a unique blend of lifestyle, convenience, and entertainment for all its residents. With
no state income tax
, you can keep more of your earnings and enjoy everything the state has to offer. The sunny, warm climate makes it ideal for year-round outdoor activities like boating, beach outings, fishing, and water sports. There are several different housing options and communities to invest in from coastal beach towns to major metropolitan areas. The state also features world-renowned attractions like Disney World and Universal Studios, and its diverse culture, influenced by Latin America and the Caribbean, brings vibrancy to everyday life. If you’re seeking sunshine, a relaxed lifestyle, and rich culture, Florida could be the perfect place for you to call home.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Fellows and residents are welcome to apply
Candidates must be residency-trained in Diagnostic Radiology
Board eligible or certified by the American Board of Radiology (ABR) or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (AOBR)
Fellowship training in Body or MRI preferred, but not required
Florida license or the ability to      obtain a Florida license
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $425,000-$500,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
For More Information Or To Apply:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Nicole Maclin at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or
843-300-1623
.

Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe, and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion, and a healthy respect for differences.

Position Description & Requirements
Western Colorado Radiologic Associates (WCRA)
, a collegial, physician-led radiology practice, is seeking a
full-time, onsite Breast Imaging Radiologist (MQSA-qualified)
to join our team in
Grand Junction, Colorado.
This position offers a balanced mix of
approximately 50%
breast imaging and 50% general diagnostic radiology
, with no overnight call and a strong focus on quality and work-life balance.
This role is ideal for a radiologist who enjoys dedicated breast imaging while maintaining general diagnostic skills within a supportive, collaborative practice environment.
Position Highlights:
Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology (ABR) or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (AOBR)
MQSA (required)
Licensed in Colorado or ability to obtain CO licensure
Fellows and residents welcome to apply
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Nestled in Grand Junction — the heart of Colorado’s outdoor playground — our radiologists enjoy year-round access to hiking, mountain biking, skiing, national parks, and a vibrant, family-friendly community. With a local airport offering easy connectivity, travel is simple and convenient.
Western Colorado Radiologic Associates (WCRA) is a progressive, physician-led practice serving several surrounding hospitals and clinics including St. Mary’s Medical Center, the largest hospital between Denver and Salt Lake City and the only Level II trauma center in the region, providing critical emergency, trauma, surgical, stroke, cancer, cardiac, women’s health, and NICU care for western Colorado and eastern Utah. We combine modern practice infrastructure with a strong culture of partnership, collaboration, and stability.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Full-time, onsite position (potentially hybrid)
50% Breast Imaging / 50% General Diagnostic
Monday–Friday daytime schedule with shared, rotational weekend coverage
No overnight call
Partnership track available
Competitive compensation with commencement bonus
Relocation assistance available
Generous time off supporting excellent work-life balance
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $450,000 - $575,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

metadata.Job Title: Day General/Breast Radiologist  - Western Colorado Radiologic Associates
metadata.Position Description & Requirements: Western Colorado Radiologic Associates (WCRA) , a collegial, physician-led radiology practice, is seeking a full-time, onsite Breast Imaging Radiologist (MQSA-qualified) to join our team in Grand Junction, Colorado. This position offers a balanced mix of approximately 50% breast imaging and 50% general diagnostic radiology , with no overnight call and a strong focus on quality and work-life balance. This role is ideal for a radiologist who enjoys dedicated breast imaging while maintaining general diagnostic skills within a supportive, collaborative practice environment. Position Highlights: Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology (ABR) or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (AOBR) MQSA (required) Licensed in Colorado or ability to obtain CO licensure Fellows and residents welcome to apply DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: Nestled in Grand Junction — the heart of Colorado’s outdoor playground — our radiologists enjoy year-round access to hiking, mountain biking, skiing, national parks, and a vibrant, family-friendly community. With a local airport offering easy connectivity, travel is simple and convenient. Western Colorado Radiologic Associates (WCRA) is a progressive, physician-led practice serving several surrounding hospitals and clinics including St. Mary’s Medical Center, the largest hospital between Denver and Salt Lake City and the only Level II trauma center in the region, providing critical emergency, trauma, surgical, stroke, cancer, cardiac, women’s health, and NICU care for western Colorado and eastern Utah. We combine modern practice infrastructure with a strong culture of partnership, collaboration, and stability. LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW Full-time, onsite position (potentially hybrid) 50% Breast Imaging / 50% General Diagnostic Monday–Friday daytime schedule with shared, rotational weekend coverage No overnight call Partnership track available Competitive compensation with commencement bonus Relocation assistance available Generous time off supporting excellent work-life balance COMPENSATION: The salary range for this position is $450,000 - $575,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Full-time, General Radiology

LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
RP Southern California is a comprehensive Radiology group that services the southern California region and multiple hospital systems within it. We are a multi-disciplinary group that covers diagnostic, body, MSK, Breast and IR throughout the region.
Lakewood, California is a warm, inclusive, city with a sophisticated, metropolitan feel with a vibrant arts, music, fashion, and design community. Plenty of restaurants, casinos, shopping, golfing, hiking and other outdoor activities; and very close in proximity to Los Angeles for quick trips. Many festivals and events occur throughout the year in Lakewood, including Pan American Fiesta and Summer Concerts in the Park, which is held on Thursday evenings in the summer. It also has great access to Disneyland and Universal Studios.

Physician-led      practice with local      clinical autonomy

and collegial      environment

Thriving      Southern California location

Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology or the      American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
CA Licensed or ability to obtain a license in the State of California

Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. Full-time, General Radiology

RP Southern California is a comprehensive Radiology group that services the southern California region and multiple hospital systems within it. We are a multi-disciplinary group that covers diagnostic, body, MSK, Breast and IR throughout the region.
Radiology Partners Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center has been serving the health care needs of its local communities for more than 45 years with comprehensive, compassionate, and award-winning care.  Our 400-bed acute care hospital is committed to helping people in our community live happier, healthier lives.

CA Licensed or ability to obtain a license in the State of California

The salary range for this position is $450,000-$600,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. POSITION SUMMARY

Primarily read for outpatient imaging centers
Excellent work/life balance practice
Monday- Friday, 8-5pm flexible scheduling
Hybrid – Remote/On-site in DFW metro
No call, weekends, or overnights
Flexible vacation schedule, no set amount
Join a group powered by 25 Rads
Partnership track
High earning potential + Signing Bonus + comprehensive benefits
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners Eagle is seeking motivated Radiologist with sub-specialty skills for our well-established program within our Dallas, Texas practice. Candidates must be BC/BE and share a vision for an integrative and collaborative care model with a multi-disciplinary team. We are committed to helping Oklahoma and Texas health care providers win the battle for wellness by providing complete, accurate radiology services for hospitals in our region. We offer highly competitive compensation, as well as malpractice insurance coverage, and CME & healthcare reimbursement.
Experience the ideal balance of flexibility and professional fulfillment in the dynamic Dallas–Fort Worth Metroplex — a fast-growing hub for advanced imaging and innovation in healthcare. Radiologists here benefit from strong hospital and imaging center relationships, cutting-edge technology, and a supportive environment for hybrid schedules that combine onsite collaboration with the convenience of at-home reading. With affordable living, no state income tax, and a central location for easy travel, DFW offers a seamless blend of career growth and lifestyle advantages. From top-tier dining and sports to exceptional schools and family-friendly communities, it’s the perfect place to thrive both inside and outside of work.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Board certified/eligible by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology or Board certified in Diagnostic Radiology
Body Imaging fellowship
Active TX license or the ability to obtain license
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $450,000-$900,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

75% MSK exclusive work
Work / Life Balance with flexible schedule
Partnership Track
Hybrid Work Option
No Overnights
Commencement and Relocation bonuses are included.  The position also includes a generous slate of benefits (including a fully funded 401k profit sharing plan with immediate vesting), as well as health, life, disability, malpractice insurance coverage, substantial PTO and moonlighting opportunities.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Greensboro Radiology is a highly subspecialized private practice group with 55+ radiologists providing patient care to multiple health systems and imaging centers throughout central North Carolina. The Greensboro Radiology mission is to lead radiology excellence through personalized and compassionate care. We have demonstrated this commitment to quality and service by implementing a single PACS/voice recognition environment throughout the areas we serve (our regional timeline).
Greensboro, nestled in the heart of North Carolina, is a vibrant and diverse community known for its welcoming atmosphere and rich cultural heritage. As the third-largest city in the state, Greensboro boasts a population of over 290,000 residents, creating a dynamic blend of urban excitement and Southern charm. Its rich history, coupled with forward-thinking development, creates a community where residents can thrive both personally and professionally. Whether you're a student, a young professional, or a retiree, Greensboro offers a welcoming home with something for everyone.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Candidates must be a Doctor of Medicine or Osteopathy
Residency trained,
ACGME Accredited Diagnostic Radiology Program
ABR or AOBR Board-certified / board-eligible
Completed a one-year post-residency fellowship training in Musculoskeletal Radiology
Preference for training in MR MSK and Spine
Licensed or ability to obtain license in North Carolina
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $500,000-$700,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

title: Day Interventional Radiologist - Alaska Radiology Associates
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Day Interventional Radiologist - Alaska Radiology Associates
City
Anchorage
Work Location Type
On-site
State
AK
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
To support our continued growth, we are seeking to add a fellowship-trained Interventional Radiologist to our well-established, multi-specialty practice in Anchorage, Alaska! This is a full-time, partnership track opportunity, offering generous compensation, and full benefits (valued at over $100k!) including malpractice insurance, disability and health insurance / HSA, 401K and CME allowance. insurance, disability and health insurance / HSA, 401K and CME allowance.
Salary: $750k-$800k + $100k benefits package
Sign on bonus: $50k or fellowship stipend
Q3-4 Week IR with IR Call (13-17 weeks per year). Remaining work weeks a diagnostic service M-F 8a-5p, 11a-7p, or 3p-10p. Diagnostic Radiology as assigned by Practice. No Diagnostic Radiology weekend shifts.
Also offering a full-time option to work onsite 26 weeks/year!
Work 26 weeks onsite in Anchorage, AK with housing and car provided
Salary: $500k + $100k benefits package ($600k total compensation)
Sign on bonus: $50k or fellowship stipend\
Mix of weeks of Daytime Cath Lab IR with Overnight IR Call and General Diagnostic Radiology with hospital-based Body Procedures (biopsies / drains). No Diagnostic Radiology weekend shifts or Diagnostic Radiology Call.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Alaska Radiology Associates (ARA) is Alaska’s largest private practice radiology group and is dedicated to providing a full range of high-quality imaging and professional radiology services. Founded in 1969, we provide full-spectrum imaging and interventional services for the largest hospital in the State of Alaska as well as outpatient imaging centers located in Anchorage, Eagle River, and the Mat-Su Valley.  Further, we provide sub-specialized teleradiology services for clients throughout the state of Alaska from Dutch Harbor to Nome and both teleradiology and onsite services in beautiful Kodiak Island, Alaska. We work closely with leading healthcare providers to diagnose and treat patients in a professional, accessible, and compassionate manner.
Enjoy working in an incredible geographic setting with urban amenities including close proximity to a beautiful international airport and convenient local regional airports. Enjoy world class hiking, sport fishing, skiing and endless opportunities for snowmobiling and mountain biking. It’s a photographer or nature lover’s dream!
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Fellows and residents welcome to apply
Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
Fellowship trained in Interventional Radiology
CAQ Preferred
Interventional Radiology to include Vascular, Biliary, Renal, Body and Interventional Oncology
General radiology procedures to include CT and US Guided Soft Tissue Biopsy and Drains (a must), Lumbar Puncture, Arthrogram injections, Paracentesis, Thoracentesis
Strong interpersonal and communication skills; focus on Radiology as a service to our patients and referring providers alike.
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $750,000-$800,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact
Ali Bethune
at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or
602-800-7016
.
ALASKA RADIOLOGY OVERVIEW
Alaska Radiology is an equal opportunity employer. ARA is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
Alaska Radiology participates in
E-verify
.

Alaska Radiology will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Full gamut of Interventional radiology (no stroke or neuro IR
Body CT/US

inpatient and outpatient facilities
Work hard/play hard
culture that values both clinical excellence and quality of life
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
ARA Diagnostic Imaging (Austin Radiological Association) is a nationally renowned radiology practice with a 70+ year history of providing exceptional service and clinical care to the patients of Austin and Central Texas. We are one of the largest radiology groups in the country, with 110+ radiologists across all subspecialties.
ARA serves 24 hospitals and operates 17 outpatient imaging centers in Central Texas. ARA partners with Dell Medical School at the University of Texas, helping to redefine how diagnostic testing is designed, delivered, and leveraged to improve health. ARA physicians serve as the radiology faculty for University of Texas Dell Medical School. As such, the practice also runs the ACGME residency program and radiologists have opportunities to teach residents, fellows, and medical students.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
ABR certified or eligible
Fellowship training in Interventional Radiology required
Comfortable interpreting general radiology studies (CT, X-ray, US, etc.)
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Eligibility for a Texas medical license
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $425,000-$450,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

or 682-220-5681.

title: Day Interventional Radiologist - Medical Imaging Associates
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Day Interventional Radiologist - Medical Imaging Associates
City
Idaho Falls
Work Location Type
On-site
State
ID
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Medical Imaging Associates is seeking a full-time Fellowship trained Interventional Radiologist to live and practice in Idaho Falls, ID. Our practice offers the full range of IR service lines including an outpatient vein clinic, high-end interventional oncology, PAD, portal venous interventions and stroke thrombectomy with a level of complexity rivaling many academic centers. We also provide subspecialty interpretations for all vascular imaging including CTA, MRA and vascular US. Interest in large vessel occlusion stroke thrombectomy is also desirable.
$3000 Monthly Stipend for Fellows in Training
$50,000 Sign-on Bonus
Comprehensive Benefits
Employee position
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Medical Imaging Associates (MIA) is the leading regional radiology practice based in Eastern Idaho and provides comprehensive imaging services in ID, WY, MT, and UT. Our practice of over 30 radiologists and 5 APPs provides the full spectrum of inpatient and outpatient radiology, diagnostic and interventional, general and subspecialty, day, and night, on-site and remote.
Come join an excellent group of collegial radiologists and support staff! We have a great collaborative work environment and atmosphere. We focus on group unity with monthly group lunches, summer and winter socials, and open communication at work. Additionally, Southeastern Idaho is home to some of the most beautiful landscapes on earth! Pocatello and the surrounding area have countless hiking and biking trails and endless places for camping and enjoying the outdoors. We are located a short drive from Yellowstone National Park, Grand Teton National Park, Sawtooth Mountain Range, Jackson Hole, Bear Lake Idaho, and multiple additional state and national parks. We have some of the best fishing and hunting in the country and endless miles of land for ATV riding, snowmobiling, or other recreation. If you are looking for a great practice and a wonderful place to live, you have found it!
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
IR Fellowship training required
Mammography days available, optional.
American Board of Radiology (ABR) certified or eligible
American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (AOBR) certified or eligible
Licensed or ability to be licensed in Idaho, Wyoming, Montana, and Utah
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $600,000-$800,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY
For inquiries about this position, please contact Geri Ferguson at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or (424) 502-1878.

title: Day Interventional Radiologist - Radiology Partners El Paso
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Day Interventional Radiologist - Radiology Partners El Paso
Functional Area
Clinical - Interventional Radiology
City
El Paso
Work Location Type
On-site
State
TX
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
RP El Paso is seeking a Full or Part Time Interventional Radiologists to support our practice in El Paso, Texas. The ideal candidate is willing to work in one week blocks (Monday to Friday) and willing to read diagnostic cases in between procedures. Must be fellowship trained in Interventional Radiology.
POSITION SUMMARY
Approximately 70% IR/ 30% Diagnostic
Day shift: Monday - Friday 8a-5p
Call: 1 weekday night/week, 2 weekend day shifts/month
Join well established group of 5 IR physicians
Group covers 6 hospitals in El Paso area
12 weeks PTO + Partnership Track
Competitive compensation + travel stipend (for contractors)
Collegial team environment, open to mentoring fellows
Opportunity for additional Call for extra income
LOCAL PRACTICE OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners-El Paso has an immediate opening for a full time, Interventional Radiologist to join our team in El Paso, Texas. The schedule for this position is Monday-Friday, 8AM-5PM, This is an onsite, private practice, partnership track position.
Weekday nights, Weekend nights and weekend day call is expected and 1 weekday night per week and 2 weekend day shifts per month are required as part paid salary, but additional shifts can be worked for additional pay on top of the base salary if requested by the radiologist.
We have a commitment to quality and ardently promote and invest in the professional development of our radiologists through a comprehensive quality assurance program. We offer highly competitive compensation, as well as malpractice insurance coverage and CME & healthcare reimbursement.
El Paso, Texas offers physicians a unique blend of professional opportunity and exceptional quality of life. Nestled against the Franklin Mountains and bordering New Mexico and Mexico, El Paso boasts over 300 days of sunshine each year, a low cost of living, and minimal traffic compared to other major Texas cities. The community is known for its welcoming culture, rich history, outstanding local cuisine, and strong sense of safety and family-friendly living. With easy access to outdoor recreation, a growing medical community, and a relaxed Southwestern lifestyle, El Paso is an ideal place to build both a rewarding career and a great life.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Fellowship trained in Interventional Radiology
Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
Doctor of Medicine (MD) or Osteopathy (DO), residency trained in Diagnostic Radiology
Medical License or eligibility to obtain licensure in the state of Texas
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $450,000-$500,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Jessica Williams at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or (405) 286-3497.

Position Description & Requirements
Position Summary
Full gamut of Interventional radiology (no stroke or neuro IR
Body CT/US
Comfortable with General Radiology
Team player and hard worker
We are seeking a skilled, motivated interventional radiologist, for a partnership track position to join our interventional radiology section in Houston.
Additional fellowship level training in interventional radiology is required. The ideal candidate will also be comfortable with general radiology.
We do heavy loads of general radiology and doing 50% general radiology during the day is the norm and not the exception. The work environment is both desirable and optimized for efficiency. The practice includes support staff, robust IT infrastructure, and optional private or common reading rooms for afterhours shifts.
We cover inpatient and outpatient facility types.
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners Gulf Coast is seeking a motivated Radiologist to join our expanding practice and service line in Texas City, TX, located along the beautiful southwest shoreline of Galveston Bay. HCA Houston Mainland is a 222-bed acute care facility, Level III Trauma Center, accredited Chest Pain Center, and a certified Primary Stroke Center.
RP Gulf Coast is a practice of over 60 subspecialty radiologists covering facilities across Houston and South Texas.
We have an established infra-structure for efficient, collaborative workflow throughout our practice.
Competitive compensation package, plus bonus opportunities
1-2 yr. partnership tracks, depending on experience
Full benefits package (health, dental, vision, 401k, disability, etc.)
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Texas licensure preferred or ability to obtain a TX license
Completion of a Fellowship in MSK/Body/Neuro/IR
Board certified/eligible American Board of Radiology or American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $400,000-$500,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

Position Description & Requirements
Position Summary
**ABOVE MARKET COMMENCEMENT BONUS!!**
Subspecialized need for 80%+ Interventional Radiology, reading DX between cases
Progressive group in Conroe, TX
Level 2 Trauma center
M-F and equitable call
Partnership track position
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners North Houston is seeking a motivated, fellowship-trained Interventional Radiologist to join our expanding practice and service line in Conroe, TX.
Live in The Woodlands, named the #1 “Best City to Live in America” for the second consecutive year by Niche.com.
The Woodlands is just North of the big city limelight of Houston without the traffic and congestion and is known for outstanding schools and beautiful scenery with just a quick commute to Conroe.
You will be joining a team of Diagnostic and IR physicians, and APPs with remote 24/7 backup.
Competitive compensation package, plus bonus opportunities
Partnership track
Full benefits package (health, dental, vision, 401k, disability, etc.)
Physician lead and governed practice
Moonlighting opportunities offer additional compensation
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Texas licensure preferred
Interventional Radiology Fellowship Required
Candidates must be residency-trained in Diagnostic Radiology, Board
Certified/Eligible in Diagnostic Imaging
Board certified by the American Board or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $425,000-$750,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. title: Day Interventional Radiologist - Radiology Partners Sol
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Day Interventional Radiologist - Radiology Partners Sol
City
Phoenix
Work Location Type
On-site
State
AZ
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
RP Sol is seeking a full-time fellowship trained Interventional Radiologist to support our growing practice in Phoenix, AZ. This opportunity is a full-time, 100% IR, partnership track position.
Strong procedural skills and      expertise in performing a wide range of interventional procedures.      Advanced procedures include cryoablation, embolizations,      kyphoplasty, TIPS, UFE and more.
100% IR focused
Flexible Scheduling options      7on/7off or 14 on/14 off
Support provided by 2 APPs      for light IR procedures
Opportunity to grow in both      clinical and non-clinical roles within the practice
Additional support tools      including VRAs, AI tools, as well as 24/7 IT and administrative support.
Opportunity to work and teach      with residents.
Supportive leadership team      with strong working relationship with trauma surgeons.
Full coverage benefits      package, as well as commencement bonus, relocation allowance, and      malpractice coverage
RP Sol offers the best of both worlds: the flexibility and close-knit feel of small practice, backed by the resources and support of a larger practice. Join our collaborative team of interventional radiologists and become part of a growing subspecialty practice!
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
RP Sol partners exclusively with the community hospitals under the Abrazo Community Care Network, providing care to an underserved patient population, including a comprehensive stroke center, dedicated heart hospital and level 1 trauma center. RP Sol also provides support and leadership in collaboration with the Abrazo leadership team.
RP Sol provides services onsite and remotely, including routine, subspecialty, emergent and after-hours imaging support. Located in the West Valley region of the Greater Phoenix Metropolitan Area, our practice serves one of the fastest-growing areas in the US. This vibrant community offers a perfect blend of suburban comfort and urban amenities. Enjoy outdoor adventures at White Tank Mountain Regional Park, catch NFL games at State Farm Stadium, or explore shopping and dining at Westgate Entertainment District. With year-round sunshine, excellent schools, and a rapidly growing healthcare landscape, the West Valley is an ideal place to live and work.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Licensed or have the ability      to be licensed in Arizona
Fellows and residents welcome      to apply
J-1s welcome to apply
Board eligible or certified      by the American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of      Radiology
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $500,000-$550,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Ali Bethune at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or 602-800-7016.

Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Radiology Partners is seeking a full-time Board Certified/Board Eligible Interventional Radiologist to join our exceptional team in Fountain, CA.
Candidate is expected to be fully functional in covering emergent interventions for an acute trauma center as well as typical hospital inpatient procedures
IR call is 1:4 to be shared equally with the other Interventional Radiologists
The group covers all aspects of IR, and candidate is expected to be fully functional in all areas. It would be a plus if candidate possessed an interventional oncology skillset.
Comfortable with all aspects of general Radiology
Partnership track position
Attractive sign on bonus
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
RP Southern California is a comprehensive Radiology group that services the southern California region and multiple hospital systems within it. We are a multi-disciplinary group that covers diagnostic, body, MSK, Breast and IR throughout the region.
Radiology Partners Fountain Valley Regional Hospital and Medical Center has been serving the health care needs of its local communities for more than 45 years with comprehensive, compassionate, and award-winning care.  Our 400-bed acute care hospital is committed to helping people in our community live happier, healthier lives.
.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Residency training in Diagnostic Radiology from an ACGME accredited U.S. training program
Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology (ABR) or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology (AOBR)
Fellowship training in Interventional Radiology is required
Licensed or has the ability to obtain a license in the state of California
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $450,000-$600,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
RP Sun City is seeking a full-time fellowship trained Interventional Radiologist. Qualified candidates should be capable of performing radiologic interventions and procedures. Radiology Partners and our Practice are committed to quality while also aggressively promoting and investing in the professional development of our radiologists through a comprehensive quality assurance program. This is a partnership track position with competitive salary.
Weekend Call: 1: 3.5 weekend coverage (Day Shift-7-3pm & 3pm-11pm)
Be comfortable reading general modalities
Shared IR and General call
A proven track record of outstanding interpersonal and communication skills is expected
Two years to Partnership track position
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Sun City is one of the oldest and largest full-service medical imaging providers in Arizona, an affiliate of Southwest Diagnostic Imaging. We are a founding division of Southwest Diagnostic Imaging, currently the 4th largest private practice radiology practice in the U.S. Offering full-service inpatient and outpatient imaging in the area since 1961, we provide state of the art professional service to 2 hospitals and 4 outpatient imaging centers. The practice is fully digital and includes 3T MR, 80+ slice CT, 3 ACR Breast Imaging Centers of Excellence, PET/CT and full Interventional Radiology services.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Arizona licensure is a must
Board certified by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology or Board Certified in Diagnostic Radiology - BLS, ACLS – DEA
Fellowship trained in Interventional Radiology
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $500,000-$600,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

title: Day Interventional Radiologist - Renaissance Imaging Medical Associates
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Day Interventional Radiologist - Renaissance Imaging Medical Associates
Functional Area
Clinical - Interventional Radiology
City
Los Angeles
Work Location Type
On-site
State
CA
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSI
TION SUMMARY
Renaissance Imaging Medical Associates, Inc., a Radiology Partners practice, is seeking a motivated and experienced Interventional Radiologist for our well-established IR program within our practice.
We offer highly competitive compensation with an opportunity for partnership, as well as benefits including malpractice insurance coverage, 401K, CME discounts, disability coverage and healthcare reimbursement.
Candidates must be residency-trained in Diagnostic Radiology, Board-Certified or Board-Eligible, and share a vision for an integrative and collaborative care model with a multi-disciplinary team. We have a commitment to quality and ardently promote and invest in the professional development of our radiologists through a comprehensive quality assurance program.
Comfortable with general and emergency radiology and minor procedures
IR call shared equitably with the other Interventional Radiologists
Light diagnostic call
The group covers all aspects of IR and several trauma centers. The candidate is expected to be fully functional in all areas. Interventional oncology skillset a plus.
Flexible schedule
Partnership track position
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
Renaissance Imaging Medical Associates is centered in Los Angeles but covers much of Southern California, as well as Maui, Hawaii. RIMA is a highly subspecialized practice where the candidate can expect to practice within their specialty on the order of 80% of the time. Studies from all RIMA locations are integrated into a single common worklist featuring advanced workflow orchestration, allowing us to get the right study to the right radiologist in the right amount of time. RIMA also operates a 3D advanced imaging laboratory that assists our radiologists in preparing state-of-the-art image data modeling and analysis.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Current California licensure preferred
Residency-trained in Diagnostic Radiology, Fellowship-trained in Interventional Radiology
American Board of Radiology certified or Board-Eligible (recent graduates falling under the new ABR guidelines)
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $250,000-1,000,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Misha Hepner at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or 818-799-3141.

Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.

title: Day Interventional Radiologist - RP South Carolina
description_text:
General information
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Job Title
Day Interventional Radiologist - RP South Carolina
Functional Area
Clinical - Interventional Radiology
City
Rock Hill
Work Location Type
On-site
State
SC
Employment Type
Full-time (30+ hrs/week)/FULLTIME
Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Radiology Partners South Carolina is seeking an Interventional Radiologist to join its established and growing IR team of physicians and APPs. This is an outstanding opportunity for a physician seeking excellent work-life balance, a supportive team environment, and a clear path to partnership.
Highlights include:
Competitive salary with commencement, retention, and incentive bonuses
182 shifts annually | 7-on / 7-off schedule
Low IR call burden
One-year partnership track
Physician expense account (CME, cell phone, etc.)
Relocation assistance and comprehensive benefits, including 401(k)
PRACTICE OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners South Carolina is a collegial, multi-subspecialty practice providing services to two local hospitals and multiple outpatient imaging centers. We are seeking our 9th partner to join the group and further support our interventional radiology service line.
This practice is well-suited for physicians who value:
Predictable scheduling
Strong APP and operational support
Long-term partnership and stability
COMMUNITY & LOCATION
The practice is based in Rock Hill, South Carolina—just 25 minutes south of Charlotte. Physicians enjoy the benefits of a growing suburban community with easy access to:
Major professional sports
An international airport
Arts, dining, and entertainment
Proximity to both the mountains and the coast
HOSPITAL OVERVIEW
Piedmont Medical Center is a 288-bed, full-service hospital serving the Rock Hill community. The hospital is recognized for clinical excellence, innovation, and ongoing expansion to meet the needs of a rapidly growing population. Piedmont is committed to delivering high-quality, patient-centered care through advanced technology, collaborative programs, and strong physician partnerships.
WHY THIS ROLE
This is an ideal opportunity for an Interventional Radiologist seeking:
Long-term career growth with partnership
Strong compensation and benefits
A balanced lifestyle without sacrificing clinical complexity
A welcoming community with access to major metro amenities
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
RP South Carolina is a newly formed practice of 8 employed Radiologist and 3 APP’s, covering a variety of subspecialty work and supporting 2 local hospitals and outpatient imaging centers.  With a 9th employed physician joining in 2025, we are looking for our 10th partner to join the group with the Interventional team.  Come work and play in Rock Hill.
Our employed radiologists have a the ultimate in work/life balance. Rock Hill, SC is located 25 minutes from Downtown Charlotte, NC, where you have access to major sports, international airport, and all the big city amenities, while being in a growing suburban community.
Piedmont Medical Center, located in Rock Hill, SC, is a 288-bed full-service hospital. Piedmont is a premier healthcare system, committed to ensuring that all patients have access to the highest quality of care. Through innovative programs, collaborations and technological advances, Piedmont is continuously expanding the scope of its services to meet the needs of the growing community. Piedmont has received recognition for growth and leadership, along with numerous industry accolades and designations.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Fellowship training in Interventional Radiology
Licensed or ability to obtain license in South Carolina
Board eligible or certified by American Board of Radiology or the American Osteopathic Board of Radiology
CAQ certified/eligible
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $500,000-$600,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
For more information or to apply:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Shea Lipp at
recruiting@radpartners.com
, or 380-203-2181.
RADIOLOGY PARTNERS OVERVIEW
Radiology Partners, through its affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion, and a healthy respect for differences.
Radiology Partners participates in
E-verify
.
Beware of Fraudulent Messages
:
Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking, financial or personal information such as a driver’s license in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment.  All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in “@radpartners.com.” If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please notify our Recruiting Team at
recruiting@radpartners.com
.

Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
Position Description & Requirements
POSITION SUMMARY
Strong procedural skills and expertise in performing a wide range of interventional procedures. Advanced procedures range from bleeding management to atherectomy, kyphoplasty and more
State-of-the-art facilities equipped with the latest technology and advanced imaging capabilities
Majority of work to be in IR (minimum 80%)
No Mammography, Nuclear Medicine or MSK responsibility
Shift assignment, call responsibility, and vacation allotment are all shared equally
Diversified revenue stream from both inpatient and outpatient sources, ensuring a steady and rewarding practice
Partnership track offered
LOCAL PRACTICE AND COMMUNITY OVERVIEW
SMIL is a well-respected radiology practice with 40 years of experience and a focus on collaboration and innovation. Our partnership with the Honor Health System includes 6 hospitals, including Level 1 trauma centers and a cancer center. With 16 outpatient imaging centers in the Phoenix area, we offer a diverse caseload.
https://www.esmil.com/
Our unique SMIL Research Institute is an entity through which we perform phase I through IV clinical research in all subspecialty areas. Interested physicians would have the opportunity to gain research literacy as well as participate in sponsored and academic clinical trials.
Located in Scottsdale, our practice is located in a vibrant and thriving healthcare community, offering a high quality of life both personally and professionally. Enjoy a warm climate, abundant outdoor recreational activities, and a diverse cultural scene.
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Candidates will be residency-trained in Diagnostic Radiology and Board-Certified or Board-Eligible (recent graduates falling under the new ABR guidelines)
This position is open to both experienced interventional radiologists and fellows completing their training
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $500,000-$600,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO APPLY:
For inquiries about this position, please contact Ali Bethune at
recruiting@radpartners.com
or 602-800-7016.
